reviews.review: The service is horrible here. From the host who couldn't care less whether I came in or not to the bar staff who I only saw twice...once to take my order and 45 min later to get my bill..I only had a chance to order one drink and a salad. Normally I'd excuse this for a busy restaurant but there's only 5 people in the entire restaurant. I can see why...

Fate led my wife and I to Michael Mina Pub in back to back nights during a recent trip to Vegas. Each night, we got the nachos. And each night, we were wowed by the nachos. They're just perfect. The pork on there was excellent. The cheese was gooey and perfectly distributed. The mix of hot and cold, soft and crunchy, veg and animal all worked.

The markup on food was what you'd expect from a "low food made high"-type place in the middle of a casino, but the quality of the ingredients used really showed that the folks there are serious about the restaurant's concept.

Two things to keep in mind are that it is dark and it is loud, even by the standards of a rowdy pub. But it always seems to be possible to grab a table, which is a heck of a thing to have going for you in Vegas.

Wandering along inside MGM and since Losers no longer serves food, we found ourselves here at Pub 1842. 

The 1842 burger was excellent! Cooked medium rare just how I like it. The aioli was delicious in tandem with the caramelized onions and grilled mushrooms. The pub fixe deal pretty reasonable at $21 for your choice of burger, beverage,and a cookie. The fries with barbecue seasoning were also addicting and I nearly polished them all off, and would have had we not had a buffet brunch that morning. Yes, Vegas is for eating!

Both our servers were very pleasant for our bachelorette party of six ladies and they were kind enough to split the check with no hassle made.
The happy hour deals at the bar were the best way to go.  Overall neat place but there are plenty of neat places in vegas.

This place had only been open 2 weeks when we first visited, so we expected a little oops in the service, but with Michael Mina at the helm of the kitchen,  the food should be a bit more consistent.  We had lunch and ordered Nachos as appetizers.  Keeping with Michael's flare for food, the presentation was interesting as were the different flavors displayed on a baking sheet, not piled high with goopy cheese.  The menu, which, by the way is not on their website yet,  said the nachos came with green chili - at lunch, there were 3 small chunks of nicely flavored pork.  A couple of days later we stopped in for a late dinner/snack, ordered them again, and yes, there was green chili with ample pork on them.  The pork really adds to the whole taste of the dish.

The Chicken Drumstick appetizer is just that - large Drumsticks - crunchy, gooey, delicious - the  Lobster Corndogs are delicious too.  We didnt order the lobster roll because we had had it several times at Nob Hill,  our favorite Michael Mina restaurant that we were so sad to learn had closed in April.  
This Pub is NOT Nob Hill by any stretch of the imagination, nor is it Todd English's Pub at City Center.

Stopped here on a whim after walking the strip for hours with the plan to get a snack but ended up eating.  OMG, the food was fantastic!!  Sat at the bar, unsure what we were going to do.  Our bartender was very patient and helpful when ordering food and drinks.  He took time to explain a few things ahead of time so we could make educated choices.  For drinks, my husband had a beer and I had Hattori Hanzo, a Japanese whisky infused with vanilla.  it was strong but very nice to sip, not at all sweet.  First we split their California Greens that came with White Balsamic.  The dressing was the perfect blend of vinegar, citrus and sweet.  Then we split an 1842 burger, which had caramelized onions and mushrooms... one of the best ever!  I like simple burgers without all the fixings so as to showcase the meat.  The sweet of the onions and earthiness of the mushrooms... my mouth is watering thinking of it. Such a surprise but the best unplanned meal on our 5 day trip!  I would love to have one of these pubs nearby!!

Las Vegas, Nevada ... MGM

I've been to this place twice now and it's really very good.  They have a great Draft selection with about 30 choices and nearly everything I've had on both occasions has been really good.  

If you like the Chicken/Waffles, order it, it's great.  I've also had the salmon burger and the peanut butter crunch burger both were very good.  

PLEASE NOTE their portions are really large, perfect for sharing.   

The only disappointment was the beer cheese and pretzels. Terrible.  But other than this everything else was really good.

Let me start this review by saying that this was not my first choice for dinner tonight. To be perfectly honest, this wasn't even on my radar of places to visit for dinner tonight. Living in Las Vegas you try to avoid going to the strip, especially on the weekend! But let me tell you that the bar tender Davey made me feel right at home! I sat down not really knowing what to expect (the service on the strip many times leaves something to be desired), but to say Davey exceeded my expectations would be a gross understatement. From the friendly banter to suggesting the perfect beer for my meal he was on point like icicles! He paid such close attention not only to me but each and every patron at the bar it's like he was old friends with everyone! I can't say enough about the level of service he provided and I'm sure he is an asset to this team or any! Not to mention the food was awesome. I had the nachos and they were delicious. I was incredibly pleasantly surprised by my experience here and there is no doubt that I will be returning! Can you say regular?!

A totally cool pub! I only partook in beer and fries, so I can only speak to a portion of what this restaurant and pub has to offer. They have a ton of really great beers on tap. I had a Pilsner Urquell, and scavenged some of my mom's fries which were pretty good! The hamburgers look divine! This pub actually has tap tables which I have never seen before. They are tables with kegs attached so you can pour your beers right at your table. You can put in a set amount like $20.00, or you can just pour to your heart's desire and get the bill after. Perfect for those of us who drink beer faster than a waiter can bring it!

One of the juiciest hamburgers I have ever had. The fries were one of the worst, unfortunately. They were seasoned with a bbq rub. The sugar was the predominant flavor. Sugar and potato is not a good combo for me personally. Otherwise, this joint is an easy 4. Get the champ burger and request that they only put salt on the fries.

It looked like a great place to sit down and have a quick, laid back lunch. Unfortunately, as I should have known... anything Michael Mina is not any of those things.

Service was slow, despite coming after the lunch rush around 1pm. Waiter was friendly, but slow about checking up on our table.

Ordered the crab cake, which was sad and dry and fairly tasteless. Boyfriend ordered the buffalo drumsticks, which smelled odd and didn't taste great either. They were breaded heavily and were dry!

Overall, it just was not a good experience. It was also quite expensive to eat here even though the food was mediocre. 

I highly advise you eat elsewhere!
Definitely NOT a destination place. Average food--menu sounds great but execution needs work. Here's all you need to know--cheese on nachos was liquid cheese. Ick.

Was told by hostess that the wait for a table even with our reservation was anywhere between 15 minutes to 2 hours. Totally unacceptable.  Decided to not wait. Hostess had a bitchy attitude.  Fire her.

Good beer bar and burgers. Sat at the bar and had a wagon wheel flyte with my daughter. Wide selection of beer with good explanations of each style. The burger and fries were good. Friendly server. Glad they are at the MGM. This type of place has been needed. Will return when at the MGM.

Food here was OK, but the service was AWFUL. We waited a full hour from when we arrived until our first drink order came, then didn't get a food order in for half an hour. I recommend any other place at MGM instead.

Pub 1942 opens at noon on the weekends. Its a fairly large pub. we were seated immediately. Pricing $$. I had the Peanut Butter Crunch burger which was soooooo good. The others ordered the Beef Brisket sandwich and the California Greens salad with bacon. The service was good and quick. I also had a handcrafted cocktail called Jar of Good Hooch. They serve water in mason jars which were cool. They do take reservations.

If u need a drink good luck came in on a Monday night, sat at the bar took 15 minutes to get a bar tender to come over. The beer was warm n good like trying to get a Guinness, talk about foam for days. There only getting a 2 start because the food was amazing.

The nachos alone made me make not one, but TWO trips to Pub 1842 on our most recent trip to Vegas. They are DELICIOUS. The rest of the menu is fantastic too. Prices are fair and service is good. In a sea of pretentious Vegas eateries, this place feels like home. A hidden gem, for real. I can't wait to come back!

We are here at the MGM for a convention. Came to 1842 right after a session and the place is packed. We sat at the bar.  We could not have had better service nor better food.  The ribs are amazing and the burger was great.  The bartenders did a great job checking on us and handling the many extras standing in the bar waiting for a table.  Highly recommend!

Ate here on 1/2/2016 for a late night dinner, had been wanting to give this place a try for awhile so was excited to finally give it a go. We were lucky enough to get a table as we arrived about five minutes before they closed, so thanks to the awesome staff for letting us in, as we hadn't eaten since earlier in the day and we were starving.

I ordered the Shrimp & Grits and chose The Double Smoked Bacon Burger.

Shrimp & Grits - never had Grits before so was curious and weary at the same time. So glad I ordered this because it was amazing. Grits were creamy and cheesy, andouille sausage was very flavorful. Only con was one of my shrimp was beyond charred on one side and actually burnt. I like charred but not burnt, I didn't notice it until after I bit into it but other than that it was very yummy.

A lot of beers on tap and in bottle to choose from. I didn't have the food, but everything I saw others eating looked great. Bartenders were personable, friendly and responsive. Drinks were made very well. A lot of bars on the strip give weak drinks, not here.  Prices may be a bit high, but overall a very good experience. I plan to come back if my travels lead me to MGM again during my trip.  The bar across the way had few beers on tap and didn't seem to have the same personable atmosphere.

Be adventurous and get the pbj burger - best thing ever - same with the duck egg rolls. Everything. Was. Amazing.

The service here is also impeccable. The manager who greeted us was friendly and made sure we enjoyed our time at the restaurant. We had two servers during the meal who were always friendly, always refilled my water and (since I'm weird and ask for a million lemons) happily brought me a plate full and refilled it when they realized they were gone. 

The food is also insanely good. Like I said the PBJ burger sounds so strange but hits my top 3 list of burgers. Food was cooked perfectly and brought out hot and well cooked. 

If I am ever back in Vegas I will definitely be returning.

I had a good experience at the Pub 1842. Hunter was our server and did a great job. He was extremely knowledgeable about the beer selection when we asked him about our particular tastes he was able to point out good selections.  
I had the peanut butter crunch burger and it was delicious!!  I believe everyone at the table enjoyed their food as well.  We did have an order of the Lobster dogs (I think that is what they are called) for an appetizer.  They left a little more to be desired in my opinion.  Overall the the evening was great and big props to Hunter he did a great job.
Came in for lunch. the burger was tasty and good, Nothing special. Good service and great location. I liked the location. The bar was nice. Lots of drinks to choose from

This pub is located inside the MGM Grand.  The beer and food selection was good.  I ordered the nachos (an item off the appetizer side of the menu) as my meal and it could have easily been a meal split among three people.  I forgot how large portion sizes are in Vegas.  That said, the nachos were freakin' delicious, definitely recommend them!

Stopped for a bite and had it at the bar. Service was prompt and food was pretty fast. The taste was creative for a seemingly normal order or tomato soup and sandwich. The soup was tangy with a zing that must have included a pepper of some kind and even though I don't like spicy things, the soup was balanced that I loved it and my husband who eats raw jalapeños easily thought it was great too. The sandwich was not greasy. The beers were nicely chilled but all drinks on tiny side.

We came here for dinner after it was open 5 days. Michael Mina has never disappointed me with his food selections. We ordered Hot Salted Pretzels, 1842 Burger, Lobster Roll, PB Crunch Burger, Mac & Cheese and Magical Mushrooms. Everything was delicious! My favorites were Lobster Roll and Magical Mushroom. PB Crunch Burger was good but wouldn't order it again with the other options on the menu. Service was great and will be back.

Disappointing barbecue overall. The brisket was tender and somewhat moist, but was was probably prepared in a pressure cooker or oven as it had no smoke flavor, bark, and most obviously no smoke ring. It needed a heavy dose of salt and pepper for at least some flavor. I could understand poor brisket quality from a diner that happens to have brisket on the menu, but this is a barbecue joint on the strip- it should rival Austin's best! To add insult to injury, $22 for two measly slivers of meat, (I estimate about 6 oz), a cornbread muffin and beans  kinda stinks.
The only reason this gets 3 stars instead of 2 is that the service was good and they made a great Old Fashioned.

Drinks were great. Thank god theyvwere on happy hour prices. The food was amazing too. Reasonably priced... For Vegas. Highway robbery elsewhere, but quite tasty.  The beer menu was ok but did not have the variety I would have expected. Lots of choices but all fell into a few categories. No wheats, no ales that I can remember but plenty of IPAs.

Technically, I should give this place a grade of "incomplete."

I showed up just to watch the Final Four.  There are tons of TVs here, so it's a good place to catch a game.

I also ate some of their BBQ-dusted fries and they were pretty good.  I like my fries a bit thicker, but the BBQ coating was pretty tasty.

It was expensive at $8, but most things in Vegas are skewed that way.

The bartender was super nice and friendly.  I'd like to go back for a meal sometime.

You must order Brisket benedict!! Always makes us happy after a good tasting meal.  Their brunch menu Lobster corndog was amazingly soft and moist. This place never disappoints us. Their coffee was even good. Will definitely be back again next time we r in Vegas.

My husband got pretty drunk playing blackjack, we came here to get some food in his stomach and some alcohol in mine (slot machines don't get you nearly as many free drinks). I had their Jungle Juice, WOW! It has a punch, but tastes amazing! I was so sad they ran out of it after two glasses. (We were there pretty late) My husband had the best nachos ever! I am really not crazy about pork, but these were just amazing. They were more then enough for the two of us. I got a wedge salad which was also delicious, but it is hard to fall in love with a salad when you are also eating nachos.

This is a great bar while waiting for a concert.  We slipped down a few frosty adult libations and had a wonderful bite to eat.  Fully charged off to the Buffett concert we went.

They have these unique tables with built in beer taps that caught my eye.  Interesting until I read they were over a hundred an hour.  Not for me and my wife, but my friends and I might give it a try. Also they carry PBR, was as good as I remember from my youth.

Probly one of the best burgers I've had!! I got the double smoked bacon burger n it was delicious! I would have to say between here n gordon ramsay burgr i would say here! Great American Burger! The price is fairly decent! Good choices in all the beers they carry also! Would definitely be coming back!

**************************** REVIEW 873 ********************************

         This much highly anticipated PUB 1842 by Michael Mina Group, recently opened at the MGM, the former spot of Sea Blue (also Michael Mina Group). Since I'm a big fan of Michael Mina restos, I was in town for work, yes during the crazy freaking EDC nightmare! I thought I dropped in for a quick visit, we ended up had a full dinner here. 

          PUB 1842 is an American pub featuring a wide selection of global beers, unique whiskey and hand-crafted coctailks by no other than the Barman/Mixologist Carlo splendorini from Michael Mina and RN74 in San Francisco. Pub 1842 offers 40 selections of beer, including ales, pilsners, stouts and lagers. TVs through out the bar,  I can only imagine Football seasons, it's going to be banana here! 

          Pub 1842 also offers  playful menu including a peanut butter crunch burger with bacon jam, potato chips and pimento cheese, the 1842 burger with caramelized onions, mushrooms, blue cheese and truffle aioli. Menu is very reasonable in price, all snacks $8-$15, appertizers $9-18, burgers $15-$19, entrees $18-32.

        What we ordered on our visit JUNE 2013:

- Homemade Frickles - crunchy fried pickles $8 - lovely, perfect snack

- Crab Louie Deviled Eggs - Maryland blue crab, dill $9 - seriously perfect bite

- Lobster Corn dogs, whole-grain mustard crème fraiche $14, Michael Mina's signature dish that you can find at Arcadia Steakhouse in San Jose, and a few Bourbon steakhouses through out the country.

- Ahi Tuna Poke, avocado, shrimp crackers, butter lettuce - also similar to Michael Mina's signature dish at his flagship restos Michael Mina at the Bellagio and San Francisco, but for less! 

- jumbo lump Crab Cake, shaved apples, green goddess, white balsamic $19 we all enjoyed this dish.

- 1842 Burger - caramelized onions, mushrooms,  blue cheese, truffle aioli - All American Wagyu beef, $18 - this burger was so juicy, tasty and the bun was perfectly shiny toasted. A MUST ORDER if you are a burger freak!

- A delish wild salmon entree $29, with corn, tomato and a lot of love by chef Michael Mina himself. It was DELICIOUS! 

CAKE & SHAKES for $9 each only, all 3, my bestie and her boyfriend die happy :-) 

- Lemon Curd Chiffon Cake & orange vanilla frappe - blackberry jam

- Shredded Coconut Cake & pina colada milkshake - white chocolate frosting

- Big Chocolate Layer Cake & chocolate malted milkshake - boiled chocolate icing

          The service was perfect, quick, efficient, and pleasant. This was day 4th since they opened and I heard they did over 1,000 serving, that's AMAZING.

          Chef Michael Mina was there at the counter going through tickets of orders at 6 PM on a THUR night, and the place was jammed packed. Thank you PUB 1842 and chef Michael Mina for another amazing meals and took so good care of us. Until a few weeks from now, we will pay another visit. 

         If you love beer, pub, burger, snack and a sport fan, PUB 1842 is a hot spot now in Las Vegas at the MGM. You can thank me later!

I am so disappointed. I loved the previous restaurant that Michael Mina had in this location. This new restaurant is a major step down in the wrong direction. The two stars are because service was really great. The food, though, gets a one star at best! This is so not typical for a Michael Mina restaurant!
I ordered the warm pretzel with cheese/ bacon as a starter for the table. Not impressive, yet rather basic. I could have done without it as I have had so much better at other restaurants. I then ordered the hummus/tahini/tomato with falafel sandwich, with Salad on the side ( extra $2 for salad instead of barbecue fries). I love falafel and know what it should taste and look like. I will describe the sandwich in one word: gross! It was way too fatty with too much tahini sauce and the falafel patty tasted like anything but falafel! I expected that it would be in a pita or wrap. It was presented like a hamburger.. Just terrible! The salad was just green leaves with an overly sweet vinaigrette on the side... Disappointing. 
The coffee was decent! 
My friend ordered their 'house specialty' burger, which she said was ok/ good, yet not great or amazing. 
This place is likely great for grabbing a beer and watching sports on some screens. It probably has good barbecue, yet like many people, I prefer to make healthier choices that I expect should be really good as on the menu! 
Therefore, will not be going back for lunch and not sure if I will ever try dinner there as lunch was pretty bad.
The best parts were good coffee and very friendly service.

This place was solid!, We stayed at the MGM for a company conference.  This place became our group hang out.  The service was good, The food was good, the table staff was pretty good.  The Bar staff was on top of their game.  The Beer selection was pretty good as well.

Has the Little Bit of Everything". That was very good, it was $43 but it was very filling. My son had the Brisket and it was done very nicely. The sauce was a nice compliment. My wife had the Green Salad, large portion dressing not over done and cashew gave it a nice soft crunch. My youngest had the kids cheese burger and it was big enough for an adult portion. We did the fries in Duck Oil with home made ketchup. The fries tasted pretty much like a fry tastes but that home made ketchup was really good. Nice atmosphere, they were plenty busy but we got in and served fairly quickly. We'll come back here for sure.

Located in the food court area between the MGM and Signature hotel, this place was very good.  My 2 friends had some specialty beer they had there while I ordered a Root Beer.  My waitress (Sara) said they didn't have any, but, she was apparently a root beer fan as well and said she may be able to get some.  In the meantime I order a skirt steak, shrimp cocktail with friends and they had the peanut butter burgers.  The waitress came back with news that the managers had found some root beer for me and brought it over.  They had gotten me a full pitcher from somewhere else to have with my meal which was pretty sweet.  Sara was very nice (and cute) and made sure we were well taken care of.  Sara was sweet and had the humor to "threaten" to drink the rest of the root beer if I didn't finish the pitcher.  Overall, the food was great, service was excellent and would definitely go back again (and even ask for Sara to serve us).
Being close to the poker room I decided to give it a try. Burgers were awesome! Plan on going back for more.

My review is based on their soft opening night which was extremely busy and only their 2nd night in operation.

The ambiance was great. It's casual, inviting, but very nice and classy. The atmosphere is very lively - a place you would go with a big group of friends.

I ordered 2 drinks from the bar - first was the Soda Popinski. It is their take on the Moscow Mule. This drink was amazing. I would actually go back just for this drink. It was light, refreshing and delicious. I think the second drink was called the Aviation (or something similar) and it was a gin cocktail with Creme de Violette and a maraschino cherry. This drink was also very good. Both drinks looked great and well presented.

The food overall was just above average. The presentation was fabulous on all food items but the flavor was not up to Michael Mina's highest standards. The nachos were eh... How can you mess up nachos? The deviled eggs were great though there were only three pieces and I ate 2 so the rest of the table was shit out of luck. The poke was pretty good. I felt like it could use more flavor and there were only 5 shrimp chips. It should definitely come with more! The crab cake was good. There was a lot of crab in there which is good but it wasn't anything spectacular!

For the entree I had the salmon done medium well. Again, this was just okay.  Lacking flavor a little. The wasabi mashed potatoes were good.

This is a beautiful space with great servers and great drinks. It was their opening night so that may have been why the food was a little off. I will definitely come back and give them another chance. I do want to try the lobster corn dog!!!

Awesome pub food.  Michael Mina, per usual, did not disappoint.  Stars of the menu is the peanut butter burger and duck fat fries.  I love peanut butter burgers (always drawn to them when I see them on the menu); if you haven't tried one before, don't hate - just try.  And the fries - oh the fries.  I had to literally throw trash on top of them to stop me from continuing to eat the plethora of fries that came alongside the burger (I hated myself for stopping myself at the time, but my tummy thanked me later :)).

They have a great deal during lunch hours - for something like $15 you can get a burger, choice of side salad or fries, a miller lite, and a cookie.  

Will definitely stop back in for a casual, laid-back lunch.

came for a late lunch.

this place is great if you want to watch a game, have some beer (or cocktails) and devour some delicious ribs. a nice break from the bougie restaurants on the strip. I had a chipotle avocado turkey burger with fries and my mom had the rack of ribs with cole slow and bourbon baked beans. both were good and portions are huge! come hungry and join the rowdy crowd if a good game is on :)

Michael Mina's Pub 1842 is an amazing pub restaurant. The Peanut Butter Crunch burger is AMAZING!!! The bacon jam mixed with potato chips on the burger is just heavenly. I would highly recommend those whose are staying at the MGM hotel & casino to stop by for a bite to eat. The Lobster Corn Dogs are also equally tasteful and delicious. This is one of my favorite restaurants located in the MGM. I have been a regular several times now when staying at MGM.

Food ok, cheeseburger well done. Forgot ID in room, but had mlife card 
Husband had to run all the way back to room to pay, waitress rude.
So much for a quick bite before swimming!

Really
Why would we give someone else points! Room number and card sufficient.

WOW!  Arrived too early to check in at the Signature and I've been here a few times in the past so I grabbed lunch. 

Awesome service from being greeted, being seated, waited on, and felt very well taken of. 

The manager stopped by to check on me and introduced herself.  Really liked being a guest at Michael Mina's. 

Let me know how your service was. By the way, I had the pork chop salad. Great flavor.

Stopped in for a quick beer and stayed for a little longer than one beer. Our bartender recommend a Scrimshaw Pilsner for me while my wife opted for a Stella. My wife then wanted whiskey and chose the Hattori Hanzo (yep, from Kill Bill) which consisted of Hakushu 12 year whiskey and vanilla bean on the rocks. That drink was just damn good! We needed some food and chose the pretzel sticks and beer cheese with a poached egg, which was also damn good! When you're at the MGM Grand, stop in and give this pub a try.

We ate here twice over the course of 3 days.  Interesting menu.  Our favorites were the hummus appetizer (it's served with lightly pickled veggies and amazing spiced soft pita) and the crunchy peanut butter/bacon jam burger.

Only error was getting the burger cooked to our liking.  We ordered it both days medium well and had to send it back when it came out really bloody.  But they are newly opened so this might get worked out.

Only disappointing items were the lobster roll (the one with corn) - the corn overpowered the taste of the lobster.  This made me sad.  I was really looking forward to this one and the Double Dog Dare which was just ok.

Very rarely do you experience a restaurant in Las Vegas where the service is just as good as the food. We had a great time with our server- ask for Pen- she will make sure you have a great night in addition to a great meal. We will definitely be coming back! #PenforPresident

This is what you should order.
1. Dbl smoked bacon burger. Don't modify it. It won best burger for a reason 
2. 1842 burger. Try adding bleu cheese or      Gouda.
3. Avocado kale Caesar. Add salmon. 
4. Wedge with Hobbs. HOBBS. 
5. Lobster grilled cheese if it's HAPPY HOUR! 
6. Brisket. It's the best f'in brisket in Vegas. 

The food is pretty damn good. It's average in price, if not cheaper, than most places directly on the boulevard. 

Oh... And make sure to try a beer you've never had. If you order a bud light, I'm sure you wouldn't appreciate the awesome food they serve. 

Little secret, they have a ton of bourbons and whisk(e)y's. So if that tickles your fancy, this pub is desirable for you.

Came back and was disappointed that they have not really improved. 

Service was still severely lacking. When we showed up there was no hostess at the desk, so we waited... and waited. And the bartenders are not top flight here. At one point a barback asked me what I was drinking, so I told him. It was some craft brew, and it was so obvious that he had no idea what I was talking about, so he just said I think we're all out and walked away. Straight walked away. 

But the food is a redeeming quality. Maybe if I sit at a table next time I'll have a better experience.

Could not have been better! Michael Mina has left no detail untouched. From the coat hangers next to booths to the homemade aioli's everything is top knotch. After meh buffet last night we wanted good food. Mission accomplished! Started with calamari. Absolutely tender and wonderful. Didn't even need dipping sauce. Also got BBQ drumsticks. Think deep fried wings but full sized drumsticks. 5 to an order. We couldn't finish. All portions were enormous!! I got the 1842 burger ($20) and was phenomenal. Truffle aioli, sautéed shrooms and blue cheese. The brioche bun was the best! My mom got the Korean salmon sandwich ($18) and it was amaze balls. The cucumber kimchee and flavorful sauce was just absolutely fabulous. My son got the fish and chips ($22). 2 huge portions of cod and the most crispy steak frites I've ever had! The service was exceptional. Pen was so accommodating and answered all of our questions and perfectly described the dishes. My water glass never got half empty (and I drink A LOT of water!!). I also got a mule ($13) and it was wonderful. Will absolutely make Michael Mina restaurants a must stop!!

Terrible Service. Overpriced Food. Good Beer.

Our waitress was really not so good at her job with very frequent interruptions, dropping things, taking away things we needed, and not being around when she was needed. Please don't interrupt my conversation to tell me you'll be right back with something. Just bring it. Don't ask me if it's okay that my burger comes with fries if there is no alternative. Don't ask me if I need another beer while my current one is half-way full every 5 minutes. 

The burger was pretty good and cooked medium-rare as ordered. It was cooked in a lot of butter though, making it too rich. When paying $19 for a burger and fries (?!!), could you please serve it to me on a plate instead of in a basket? The sauce and juices drip all over the fries, making them soggy. The fries were sub-par. I would expect thicker cut fries, skin on, or something other than what looked like and tasted like McD's fries. And $1.50 sharing fee? No thanks. 

The beer menu is good with very high prices. It's not easy to find craft beer in Vegas, but this bar has a decent selection. I went back the next day for Happy Hour to get a deal on a pint, but sadly the Happy Hour specials are only on cocktails and tall boy cans of PBR. Really? You're a craft brew pub, but you feature the worst beer in cans as your special? No thanks. The Todd English P.U.B. at the Aria has equally good beer and half-price pints for Happy Hour (3-6). 

If you are stuck at the MGM Grand and need a bite or a beer, there are worse options. I'm sure most of the food is delicious, but I couldn't afford to try it.

Really disappointed with the food and service, so mediocre and I expect more from this chef. Seems he sold out. Non memorable hamburgers and chicken. Pretzel appetizer tasted store bought. Mushrooms had a terrible lingering taste I could not put my finger on, like they had been smoked for days on end. Ordered 4 appetiers, 3 came out really cold. Corn on the cob was cold and uninspired. Sad day for us Mina fans. Food lacked flavor and appropriate seasoning. Pickle garnish was wilted and warm and looked too old to be on the plate

Wow! We dined at Picasso the night before. I didn't think too much about what we would have for lunch the day afterwards. I found this restaurant on yelp and thought it was worth a try. I have been to many Michael Mina restaurants that I have found less than satisfactory. But, this one was the highlight meal of our weekend in Las Vegas. My wife and I ordered the fried BBQ pork skin, fried chicken and waffles and the Champ burger. Everything was absolutely perfectly executed but so over the top.  The best way I could describe the food is as Paula Dean and Thomas Keller had a love child they would have 1842 pub. For example, their take on the bloody Mary was out of this world (house barrel aged bourbon with two slices of crispy bacon). I wished we could have come back for dinner the next day. But, my heart would have stopped beating from part coronary blockage and part pure joy. Go here if you get a chance.

Everything about this lunch was top notch. If you're in the mood for a burger for lunch, the, Prix Fixe is the way to go. 

The 1842 burger was very, very good. Mushrooms, caramelized onions, and truffle aioli? GET IN MY BELLY! The fries were amazing. The chocolate chip cookie? Amazing! 

The milkshake? Yup! You guessed it. It was very well made. 

Here's where I really appreciate them. THEY OFFER FLIGHTS OF MILKSHAKES!

You can get a taste of all four milkshakes (vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, and salted caramel) for $10.

Neat. Just neat!

Ate here before a UFC event. Nothing special, no one pleasant.

Pros: It's not far from the Arena? Big selection of beers and plenty of TVs.

Cons: Food options were limited and they weren't that good. We only got a bunch of apps, but usually apps are killer so we were disappointed. Service was not very friendly and quite slow.

I would try this place again on a less busy day and try the entrees next time.

The happy hour is great! I seriously ordered several drinks prior to the end of happy house (got there at 6:30 and happy hour ended at 7). The drinks were cheap and delicious! The waiter was comical and gave us a wonderful service. If I didn't come here the night before, I would come here over the craft steak across from this place. Much friendlier service and food was a lot more memorable. They do not have a kids menu but everything they have can me accommodated to a kid size. Definitely accommodating with kids. We had the warm spinach salad with salmon and peanut butter crunch burger. I love peanut butter and on a burger was a heavenly combination. The French fries are addicting. I ate so much of it that I couldn't finish the burger!

Asian Chopped Salad, Brisket, Burger, and everything that we ordered including the fried pickles were delicious! I'd definitely come back here to try something new. Our waiter was very helpful and gave us a lot of insight on what to order and what's in what. He came back often to check up on us which was really nice. The price is decent, not cheap but not expensive either. A lot of tvs to watch your sports game and a huge bar area.
Peanut butter crunch burger is bomb. Doesn't get soggy, right amount of sweet and savory, filling.

First of all the food and drinks are great but the best part about the Pub is the waitress, Pen. Pen is seriously the best waitress ever. Shes so honest and kind and very helpful. I have had her twice during separate visits and would come back just to talk to Pen. #WeLovePen

My girl friend and I were passing through and stopped in for a quick drink while waiting for our hubbies to get out of work.

She had been craving a sangria but it wasn't on the menu.  She asked the bartender if he would make her one, and he said he would make one for her.  She was ecstatic. After he made it, he even asked her to try it first. We both agreed it was delicious.

I ordered a mule which was also quite tasty. 

Very nice experience, even for  a quick minute.

Loved it. Great atmosphere,  server, staff, and especially the food!  We had the crab cake appetizer, pulled pork chile verde, and the Double Dog Dare (bacon wrapped, two franks), as well as a tasty IPA they had on tap.  We will definitely stop here again, and plan to visit other Michael Mina establishments in California.

Not impressed. We stopped in for an afternoon snack. Ordered two apps...nachos and duck spring rolls. The nachos were plentiful but I didn't like the fake cheese sauce and sour cream that was drizzled over the whole thing. The pickled peppers were really good, though. The spring roll had good flavor but was strange. It wasn't deep fried, more like sauteed and greasy. Beer was good and service was attentive. Will try somewhere else next time.

Stopped in here Friday night after visiting TopGolf. Its a nice bar style atmosphere, with friendly service. The menu isn't huge, and after reading reviews it must change a lot because some of the other reviewers recommendations weren't on the menu.

Happy Hour is 2pm-5pm, and we arrived around 6 so I can't inform you on the deals. 

I ordered a nice refreshing vodka, lemon lime, muddled cucumber drink that was light and refreshing. My friend and I shared the appetizer of BBQ chicken drumsticks in a Carolina sauce. The drumsticks were big, 6 of them, for $14. I loved the sauce, tangy and sweet with just a hint of heat in them. Almost overpowering but good. Drink prices were a bit high, as is typical with a Strip location. 

Thanks to our bartender who was really helpful and friendly. I can't remember her name but she was great and right on top of the whole process.

This place is located inside of the MGM Grand and is not only affordable, but delicious! I think we all can agree that Vegas can have some overpriced restaurants, but this place is the perfect marriage between delicious and affordable.

I came here though the suggestion of a close friend of mine, who was eager to come here. When we approached the restaurant, the hostess warmly greeted us, and gave us some suggestions on her favorite menu items. When we finally sat down, our server IMMEDIATELY greeted us and gave us water. He was well informed, clear, efficient, and funny. My friend and I decided to go for their burger special which includes any burger, a drink, and a cookie for $18.42 (so cute given the name!)

My friend ordered the bacon burger, and I ordered the 1842 burger. If you like a simple burger, go for the bacon burger. If you want a burger that is messy, filled with stuff, and bursting with flavor, get the 1842 burger. The fries were equally as delicious as the burger, and the cookie that came with the deal was soft, warm, and soooo good. I must say, I was impressed. Food came out quickly, and the burgers were perfectly medium-well.

If I return to vegas, I will definitely return here. Trust me, the calories are worth it.
After getting out of a late show we ran across this pub and boy was we surprised! Good Food excellent service what more could you want at midnight? Thanks guys!

The double smoked double bacon burger was great.  Also the happy hour drinks were really affordable compared to the regular drinks. The best part was our server Hunter had great product knowledge and we appreciated his menu recommendations.

Omg best turkey burger I've ever had! Hands down! I would move here for this burger!...a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for--the burger was HUGE! I wasn't able to finish the whole thing (as much as I would love to). I wish they offer a smaller portion. Overall awesome experience! Would definitely recommend!

My boyfriend and I went to this pub for lunch with very little expectations. I ordered the vegetarian felafel burger and he ordered the turkey burger. We got to have a choice of either salad or fries to accompany our burgers. I chose fries and bf chose the salad. We were pleasantly surprised by the portion size and oh the taste of the burgers were so good. My felafel burger did not look too appealing at first but I fell in love with it on the first bite. Love at first bite! The fries were out of this world amazing! We've never had fries cooked like that before. The seasoning used was very yummy. We were very happy with the service as well. For an easy no fuss meal, this place is the place to go. We were disappointed that it was closed on our last day at the MGM. Would have loved to have another burger before we went back home.

My friend and I thought it would be fun to try Pub 1842 for a "light" lunch, considering all we do is eat when we go to Vegas. I can't say that it was necessarily a "light" lunch, but it was delicious.

The ambience is really fun, and we sat in a table toward the back of the restaurant where we had plenty of space to relax and unwind after a morning filled with shopping and walking. Our server suggested the Southside to start, and I was intrigued. They only make 15 large jars per day of this drink, so I decided to take advantage of this special drink. It's just beefeater, fresh lemon juice, and mint. Super delicious. Super refreshing. Of course I ordered a second drink. My friend had the pub's version of a moscow mule, and loved it. 

We shared the fried pickles, which were perfectly crispy and not greasy at all, and our server recommended the Greek salad and I was requesting "lighter" fare. The delectable lamb meatballs on the salad weren't exactly "light," but I loved them. They definitely made the salad.

I'm not sure how it would be for dinner, but everything I tried at lunch was very good.

Great upscale sports bar that provides a large selection of beers on tap and some great barbecue food to pair all those beers with. 

We had the nachos for an appetizers which came on a big baking sheet, I like the use of pots and pans to serve food. For entrees I went with the Pulled Pork, Brisket, and Spare Rib Platter with a side of Kale Slaw. The kale salad was good but my wife's not a fan of mayo in cole slaw. The spare ribs were a little tough, they didn't fall off the bone like I was expecting. The pulled pork was good but probably no different than Chipolte's Pulled Pork. The brisket was a little dry but the biscuit that came on the side was my favorite. My wife had the burger Medium Well which is a terrible way to eat a burger but that was really tasty and moist so they did well there.

My biggest beef would be that the bar seating is what they use for their dining guest. Correct me if I'm wrong but most table within the bar area are first come first serve and not part of the dining room. As you can imagine it's pretty noisy and you have people standing around next to you as you try and have a date with your significant other. All in all the prices I thought were high for what you get, but all of Vegas is over priced so I have to keep that in mind.
Melt-in-your-mouth burger! The lobster corn dogs were pretty amazing, too. Love the saloon-style decor, and the well-versed staff.

I have seen a bunch of the bad reviews for here. I don't get it.
If you are near the MGM and are looking for easy comfort food, this is a great place.
It is comfortable, casual and not expensive. And if you are a sports fan, you will be in heaven! There is not a seat in the house that does not have a TV available. And a 99% chance that it will be sports playing if there is something going on!

The burgers are awesome, apps are delish, the service is fun. 

It is definitely a touristy spot, and gets busy. Make a reservation!
For us locals, a great spot to go before a show at the MGM.

Great beer selection! The lobster bites and burgers are awesome. However, the mac and cheese was pretty lackluster and tasted like buttered noodles. The seasoning on top was a good touch, but it definitely needed more cheese.

Typical pub food, but slightly fancier because of the name Michael Mina?

The portions here are HUGE!!! I would strongly advise having someone to share your entree with, unless you're so hungry you can eat a whole cow. 

The nachos here do not come on a plate... they give it to you on a whole damn toaster oven sized TRAY that it's baked on! Mmmm... very good but so freaking huge.

Fried pickles: they are not sliced pickles; they are whole pickles and come with some magical sauce. Mmmm...

**GREAT CRAFT BEER SELECTION**

Sausage and Egg sandwich was awesome. The egg with bites of sausage on a perfect Texas toast was great!   I was apprehensive about adding on the harissa sauce  which the waiter said was like a Mediterranean aoli sauce but i must say the sauce added an extra pizazz to the sandwich which made it a delightful taste and why I gave it a 5 star.   Would definitely recommend you try it.
Good happy hour fare and an OK selection of beer. Not busy at this time,  food served quickly. Don't get the $$ on Yelp, I'd say that applies only to happy hour.

I had the BBQ brisket, and it was pretty good.
The bartender was a little snotty, but our waiter was awesome.

The service was slow. 
The beer selection was pretty good if pricey.
The burgers were good.  They allowed custom orders too.
The BBQ fries did not work for any of us and we were starving.  I  love fries, almost any fries, but these were not good.  If I were forced to eat here again I'd try the fat fries or get the BBQ fries without the BBQ salt. Hated it. B

I should make a meme that says, "I don't usually eat beef burgers, but when I do, it's a $24 beef burger!" cuz it's a true story. I just think if I'm paying that much, I'm less likely to be eating pink slime. Either that, or I'm paying assloads for pink slime. Shudder at the thought. 

Pub 1842's peanut butter crunch burger is weird in all the right ways with the PB being more savory than peanut buttery. The bacon jam & potato chips just make this thing. I ordered it well-done & it came to my table rare. They'd halved the burger for bf & I to share & he dug right in to the pink (nasty, nasty thoughts.) Five minutes later, I had a completely cooked patty & the grubbin' began. Fries portion: unnecessarily over-generous. 

Add shrimp cocktail at $18 & a $4 diet coke & booyaw, brokey status! That's Vegas for you, baby! 

Sweet blonde waitress. Cool beers on tap right at your table (which I recommended to my beer connoisseur buddy...he complained it was $22 of mostly foam in his pitcher. My bad.)

My husband and I are big fans of Michael Mina and his newest venture did not disappoint.  

We went in and sat at the bar last Friday night - opening weekend.  There was a good crowd but we were still able to grab a couple of the last seats when we showed up just before 6:00 p.m.  Overall, the staff was friendly and service was good.  The bartender seemed a little bit overwhelmed, but she was handling the crowd and the drink menu well.  Michael Mina's drink lists (here and at his other restaurants) demand a bit more out of his bar staff than many other restaurants.  Nonetheless, she was friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, the drinks, and Chef Mina's cuisine generally.

Chef Mina was expediting that night and was working - not there just for show and glad-handing.  He came over to speak to us briefly (and was very gracious) but quickly returned to work.  We saw him send a couple of dishes back and seemed to lay eyes on every dish that went out while we were there.  We observed him interacting with his  kitchen staff and his wait staff about service.

The drink list is a little more accessible than his other Vegas restaurants - more beer and "fru-fru" drinks (smaller drink menu and not focused as much on old school whiskey and gin cocktails).  I had the Heist and the Jungle Juice.  The Heist was a fantastic cocktail - great fresh strawberry flavor but without being overly sweet.  The Jungle Juice was a bit sweet for my tastes, but a good drink.  My husband had the Old White and an Old Fashioned.  Oddly, the Old White came in a shot glass, but was a very good drink.  The Old Fashioned was superb.

We started with the Crispy Chicken Drumsticks with chipotle lime glaze and the Homemade Frickles.  Both were excellent.  The chicken consisted of four regular sized drumsticks (not drumettes), which were amazingly crispy and the chipotle lime glaze was both spicy and flavorful.  The fried pickles were battered, light, and crispy, but the batter didn't overwhelm the pickle.  We tried to order the Lobster Corn Dogs, but they were already out (it was about 6:30).  

For entrees, I had the Lobster Roll and my husband had the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger.  The lobster roll was very good - a good portion of lobster mixed with creamed corn, popcorn for a little texture, on an oversized Parker Roll.  Not quite a knife and fork sandwich, but not something to eat while walking!  The only real criticism I have is that the roll gets a bit soggy by the time you get to the second half of the sandwich due to the creamed corn.  Nonetheless, the sandwich was great and still a value at $27 (compared to other strip offerings) .  The lobster was almost all cooked perfectly - a couple chewy pieces, but overall was great.  The website menu lists it as being made with jalapeño creamed corn, but I don't think that's the description on the menu we received in the restaurant.  (I didn't taste any jalapeño.)    My husband really enjoyed the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger.  He commented that he would have liked more potato chips on it, but that when he got a bite that had all of the components together, it was fantastic.

We didn't have enough room for dessert, but we'll surely be back again.  Our only wish is that there was a better bourbon and scotch list, but - to be fair - the name suggests that is not the focus.
Pretty good food and burgers. Only complaint is the service is reaallllly slow.  Other than that everything we had was really good.
Naw! Michael Mina and his influence or stamp just is getting lame and spread thin. Concentrate on a few and make your brand great rather than growing too fast for naught!

Beer selection was just ok. Chicken drum app was good.  Shrimp cocktail looked like it came from a frozen ring you get at the supermarket. When the fried chicken and waffle salad came out undercooked I was so excited that I could send that awful thing back without having to say I was disappointed and the ranch dressing was sour. I wanted to try something new but it was not good. The few pieces of waffles were hard and small like cereal. They offered dessert since I did not want to try anything else. Dessert was ok. They serve mini milkshakes with each one they were good. The pecan dessert was the best. The chocolate cake tasted like old cold store bought cake. They also gave a key lime ripe of cake that they should be embarrassed to serve. I love that type if dessert but it was bad!   Don't waste your time here there are plenty if excellent restaurants on Vegas. I love to find out and this was not cheap and not very good. I was do excited to try a Michael Mina restaurant and now I don't want to try another one. Ill end on a positive note by saying the staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Not the greatest food or experience. 

Food: 5/10 - I had the peanut butter and jelly burger which I thought sounded like a winner but in fact it was kinda' boring.  No real taste of Peanut butter or Jelly.

Service: 6/10 - Server was missing in action frequently.  When he was around he would make corny jokes. 

Cleanliness: 9/10  - No problems with cleanliness.  Things were in order.

Restrooms: N/A - Didn't visit.

Parking: 7/10 - Lots of parking in the MGM parking garage.

Overall: 6/10 - There are so many better options in Vegas that this place. If you want a better burger go to Gordon Ramsay BurGR in the Planet Hollywood nearby.   I left the restaurant uninterested and will not likely return.

I will be honest, I heard this place had a peanut butter burger and had to try it. I love peanut butter. 
So we go in and order. Its a pub with TV's going so nothing too special about the atmosphere. 
I did get the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger. Seriously, one of the weirdest things I have tried. My mouth was so confused when I first bit into it. The sweet from the peanut butter, the crunch and salt from the potato chips, then there's the bacon jam. Plus that really good angus beef patty. Its a hefty burger for sure. So it took a few bites before I decided how I felt about it. But then I realized that I love that burger. It was so good. I wished I could have eaten another. 

My girlfriend had the spicy chicken sandwich. She enjoyed it. Its a buffalo sauce sandwich. She really enjoyed it. 

Their sandwiches and burgers come with BBQ fries. They are regular fries seasoned with a BBQ seasoning and they are delicious. 

I really enjoyed eating here. That darn Peanut Butter Crunch Burger is so weird but so great.

It's pub food and pretty tasty pub food at that. Oh, and they make a mean margarita too.  We kicked off our meal with the soft pretzels that come with a side of "beer cheese" with a poached egg in the middle. The pretzels were nice and warm and you can really taste the beer in the cheese. The egg made no sense and I avoided it like the plague.  I also reached for and bit into what I thought was fried zucchini, only to discover it was a fried pickle. Once I got over my initial surprise, I really liked it!  For dinner, I ordered the Champ burger, which was big, juicy, and messy. It was really good, and I don't know what it was ... maybe the fourth margarita, but I just got tired of eating. May I add, the bun was super soft, if you care about that. Good fries too. Very attentive service and left full and happy. What more can you ask for?

Just when I thought I was done with my hipster beer encounter, we got suckered into claiming the BOGO PBR check-in offer. I had my share of 2 beers but felt absolutely nothing. Our server was awesome. We had lots of questions and requests and he delivered. We tried the hot soft pretzels, 1842 burger, peanut butter crunch burger, a bit of everything BBQ plate and the baked ziti "pie".

Hot Soft Pretzels:
Pretzels with 'Merican beer cheese and poached egg. We were iffy about the poached egg. One person in our group is not a big fan of eggs and I'm not a fan of egg yolks especially if it's runny. But at the same time, we want to know what it's like to have it the way it was meant to be served. Our server gave us two sauces: one with poached egg and one without. Brilliant! A friend had to mix the poached egg and 'Merican cheese together as I looked away. The egg made the sauce a bit thicker. The pretzels themselves weren't all that great or soft. 3/5

1842 Burger:
Caramelized onions, mushrooms and truffle aioli with a side of fries. I asked for extra truffle aioli for my fries. Medium-rare perfection, natural sweetness from the onions and the flavor and fragrance of truffle aioli. The fries were thin and crispy and sprinkled with chopped parsley. They put pickle spears on top of the bun - no pickle juice touched my meat, yay! 4/5

Peanut Butter Crunch Burger:
Bacon jam, crushed wavy potato chips and chunky peanut sauce, fries on the side...pimiento on the side per our request. This seemed so interesting so gave it a try. It wasn't exactly peanut butter they slathered on the bun but a peanut sauce with chunks of peanuts. I tried it with and without pimiento. With the pimiento, it was like eating a Thai burger - nutty and slightly spicy. It was good the first few bites but the texture and flavor overload wore me out that I couldn't finish it. 3.5/5

A Bit of Everything BBQ Plate:
Ribs, brisket and pulled pork. Comes with kale slaw, jalapeno cornbread, baked squash and baked beans on the side. The meats were tender, sweet but vinegary. "This is better than Rollin Smoke." 4/5 

I was so full I didn't try the bake ziti "pie" so you'll have to wait for John F's review - if he ever writes one. They have football specials every Sunday, Monday, Thursday and Saturday for beers, shots and burgers. For dessert they have: shakes (with or without alcohol), big chocolate layer cake, warm cookies & shake and butterscotch custard. We had no room for that.

Came here for lunch and had a green salad and half order of the nachos - between two people it was about $35 which is a little steep but seems on par for what you pay in Vegas.  To add a chicken breast is really $9??  The portions they give you are fairly generous though so I recommend splitting things unless you want to walk away with a ton of leftovers.  Both dishes were super tasty!

The service - just top notch!  Super attentive and friendly and they were really great about recommending options and favorites. 

Cool space - I love the MGM so if you are craving a good sandwich or some yummy bar style food, this place is a great option!

We went to Las Vegas for a few days in June and 1842 was one of the first restaurants we went to. It wasn't on our bucket list or anything- it was just open and we were hungry. Overall, the service and food was pretty good.
I got the Pulled Pork Sandwich. It came with pickles, and bbq spiced fries. It was really good, but this restaurant only has one bun that they use for sandwiches. I guess some places either don't realize that customers with food allergies come in- or they just don't care. So, I had to eat my Pulled Pork Sandwich in a glass bowl with no bun. I do recommend the dish. It was really good, but on the expensive side.

One of the best Jems in Las Vegas.  We stumbled across while avoiding rain. The nachos were huge,affordable, and delicious.  The burger was delicious and had an amazing secret sauce.  Service was amazing.  They split our food without us asking.  We ordered the drink specials for $8 and we're not disappointed with the amount of alcohol included.  Highly recommend trying this place when in Vegas.

One of the best meals we've had in Vegas and we've been to Vegas almost 60 times. The kale Caesar salad was bonkers, I had the bbq sampler with a pbr, she had fish and chips. Best fish and chips, ever. Brisket was beautiful and the ribs were fall off the bone. She got a Cosmo in a bottle to drink and loved that too. We will be back.

The food was delicious but the service is very slow and the servers were not comfortable describing the menu items or very attentive in general. We ate here two times recently mid afternoon meals and even giving them some slack for being newly opened, we would hesitate to be back. Work your bugs out and then open your doors, especially at these prices.

Not the best pub in Las Vegas, but cool atmosphere. We had the lobster corn dogs and duck spring rolls, both good but not spectacular. I had "the champ" burger, pretty good and it came with fries so that's a plus. I also had the jungle juice drink which was pretty yummy! I'd recommend this place if your looking for casual bite

We visited on a recommendation from someone at the Mlife desk, as we simply wanted a place we could wear jeans to and catch the game.   This was an excellent place to dine, drink and watch sports.  The atmosphere was casual and fun, the waitstaff were extremely prompt and my glass was never empty.

There was music playing and there were many TVs on all sides of the bar. It was spacious enough to hold a lot of people and not be overcrowded.  We sat in a booth near the bar, which was pretty comfortable.

We tried the soft pretzel appetizer, it came with some cheese for dipping.  It was warm and soft, very tasty.  My friend ordered the wedge salad with skirt steak on it.  The lettuce wedge was HUGE!!  I ordered the skirt steak with a side of French fries.  I have to say, I wasn't quite sure what to expect (I mean, it's skirt steak), but when it arrived I was *very* pleasantly surprised.  I ordered it medium well, which almost always gets screwed up at restaurants.  It was cooked exact to my liking and it was so juicy and tender, I was truly impressed!  The fries were pretty good too, but I only had a few, as the portion of the skirt steak was pretty generous.

The beer menu was very extensive, I had a hard time deciding on what to get.  They had a nice selection on tap, including some good IPAs (even the Sierra Nevada Red, which was pretty tasty).  The bill for two of us was around $65 for appetizers, two drinks and food.  I would recommend this place for something different than your typical bar food, but with a sports bar atmosphere.

The worst dining experience I have EVER had. I went to Pub 1842 with a group of 9. Our server was horrible and rude. Once we ordered, I was talking to a friend while the server collected the menus and I didn't notice it, instead of just leaving the menu or waiting for me to realize what he was doing, the server just yanked the menu out from under my arms. It startled me. We ordered our food and some appetizers. After 40 minutes, nothing!! I couldn't track down any employee, so I got up and looked for the manager. The manager was just as rude. I told him this issues, very politely and all he did was nod his head. No sorry, he didn't even utter a word to me. I walked back to the table and our food was FINALLY there. The appetizers came out with our entrees, 2 of the dishes were messed up and one side dish never even came out. And again no apology. I get it, there are bad nights in food services, I was a waitress. All it takes is an acknowledgement that things got messed up. But we got nothing! Our bill came (we waited for it for 20 minutes!!!) and they even charged us an 18% tip for our large party. Again, we brought the manager over to tell him our concerns. The manager still didn't say one word after he heard our complaints, all we got was a head nod. One of my friends piped up and said that we should, at the very least, not pay for the 2 appetizers that we got. The manager nodded his head and I heard him say the first words to us of the night. His response was "Fair enough". Again, no sorry or "I'm sorry you feel that way". Never, ever will I eat here again.

By far best place we ate at in Vegas.   And for a burger joint that says alot!   Great food and service.  Manager very attentive and you can tell he loves his job.  We ordered mac n cheese, Brussel sprouts, wedge salad with thick cut bacon, burger, and two steaks.  Wow wow wow.   Everything rocked!   Definitely coming back for more!
One of the best burgers I have ever had, the only real downside is the service is incredibly slow. I mean painfully slow.

Let's see... Stopped in for happy hour prior to the Justin Timberlake concert at the Grand Garden. The place wasn't terribly busy. My girlfriends and I took seats at the bar.

Happy hour drink menu is decent. Cocktails and wine are included, as well as $3 drafts. I selected a drink that is pretty much a Moscow Mule with a fancy-fied name for a gastropub. I got a pinot noir in at the very end of the HH, it was decent, a fairly run of the mill California varietal.

Food is not included on the HH menu. O well. I was starving. Ordered the Double Dare Dog for $19. *facepalm* Well what can you expect? I shelled out twenty bucks for two hotdogs, wrapped in bacon, topped with guacamole, salsa (pico de galloesque) and Chicharrones. Came with unimpressive Luke warm fries. Hot dog WAS good. Flavors were playful, different. What you would expect from a gastropub. FYI: I had a serious tummy ache later... I think it was just too rich for my system.

Service was laaaah-AME! We were ignored at the bar by the bartender on numerous occasions. My drink sat empty without being asked for a new one. Bartender seemed uninterested... That is until we waved her down. 

Ambiance is.... Fancy sports bar with expensive bar food. You must get ready to break out monies and just not give a crap about the fact you're paying way too much because you're on the Strip and it's Michael Mina.

Chance for return? Highly unlikely but not completely annihilated from my dining options.

My wife and I came here for a late lunch while were staying at the MGM's Signature hotel.  At first we wanted to sit at the bar but most of the seats were taken and the all of the two person high-top tables had "reserved" signs on them which I didn't understand.  We grabbed a beer and a cider (quite expensive at nearly $20) and asked for a sit-down table.

We ordered the 1842 (caramelized onions, mushrooms and truffle aioli) and the Bacon burger, both at $19.00 each.  I thought they were good.  I also ordered the "hair of the dog" which was a shot of Jim Beam and a shot of pickle juice.  We call this the "pickle-back" here in San Diego.  At only $8 this was possible one of the better values.  The interior is not terribly huge or decorated in a memorable way.  There's a little outside patio type of area with standing hooks for your jackets or hats which I thought was a nice touch.

Overall I wish there was more variety on the menu and wasn't blown-away like I am at some other Vegas restaurants (hence only 3 stars) but I would go back to Pub 1842 try some other things which may get it more stars (especially these lobster corn dogs I keep hearing about).  This is my first Michael Mina restaurant.

Happy hour...grilled cheese with lobster and Korean ribs absolutely delightful.  Great atmosphere service and price.
Crowded but it's vegas.
Oh and the craft beer at $4 can't beat it.
Highly recommended if your headed towards vegas and stopping in the mgm grand.

3 stars with 4 star potential. The duck egg roll apps were great. I got the chinese pork salad and it was a bit salty/heavy for my taste, esp for a salad. Others from my group got the fish and chips, chicken and burger - I think they all were good but nothing outstanding.

Burgers were exceptional.  Unfortunately the slow service and numerous mistakes made on the food orders and bill bring the rating to barely acceptable.  Would expect much better from a Michael Mina establishment,

Went around 5:00 on Friday night & the place was packed. Sat at the bar. Service was ok....one bartender better than the other. Ordered frickles, happy hour lobster grilled cheese, and a BLT. The BLT was the stand out. My husband and I both agreed it was the best one we've had in Vegas yet! We would go back just for that. Plus it's large enough to share.

Great place to hang with friends and enjoy a meal. Lots of TV monitors so you can watch your favorite game. Not many beers on tap but a decent selection.

The food is very good! One friend ordered nachos and I have to say they were a unique, flavorful take on this traditional bar favorite. We also had their Homemade Frickles (fried pickles) and they were good too.

I had the Green Chili - Heritage Pork and liked it a lot. Good flavor and not too salty. Some places seem to use salt as their main ingredient for soups and chili, not here!

The price is pretty steep for bar food. But you're going to have a great food experience in a nice atmosphere, so the trade off is probably worth it.

Credit is due where credit is due, even if delayed:

This is a kudos to the evening shift at Michael Mina Pub during a visit back in January.

I came in, sat by the bar, and ordered an entree, beer, and whiskey tasting flight. Unfortunately halfway through my meal, I bumped a whiskey glass with my beer stein, and shattered the glass. As I reached for my napkin to wipe up the mess, my bartender immediately sprung into action to contain the spill. Seconds later, a guy dressed in a suit (I'm guessing the MOD) walked towards me.

At this point, I'm thinking, "Well, time to be told I'm drunk and get thrown out."

The suit instructs me to please put down my napkin, and let his staff handle the clean up. Then, to my utter surprise, he apologizes to me, and says he would like to place a new order for everything. Astonishingly, he cooly explains that it would be unsafe and unacceptable to let a guest continue a meal potentially contaminated with glass.

Outstanding.

New Year's Eve dinner on the fly- no wait at 8 pm made it a very attractive option in a sea of pre-fix menus and required reservations. 
 Sat at the bar and ordered nachos (delicious), calimari (standard, but chipotle marinara was to die for) and peanut butter crunch burger- I hate peanut butter, but snuck a taste of the patty from my party's plate and it was amazing! 
 It's not cheap, but you get a ton of food and this fed 4 people. 
 Beer selection on tap was pretty good, but I do sort of question maintenance of the line. I ordered a Belgian brew with complex name, it was supposed to be witbier, but can honestly say it tasted like bud light, and looked like it. Argh.
 Aside from that hiccup- service is awesome, food- delicious, highest marks!
Burger was wrong and then under cooked.  Fries were very over cooked. Don't waste ur money

I'm giving this place 3 stars for the uniqueness of the menu. I enjoy seeing new things on a menu and this place delivered! We came for lunch and were seated automatically.  Our server popped right by for our drink order and seemed irritated that we were only having water. I believe he asked us a total of 5 times if that was all we were having.  We were just relaxing browsing the menu and ordered the lobster corn dogs for an app. They came out quickly and weren't very hot or fresh.  Nothing great about them at all which was a disappointment as we had read other reviews raving about them. There was also a small piece of shell in one of them. The server stopped by twice to see if we were ready to place our entree order yet and once again seemed irritated that we weren't decided. We were simply looking over everything and wanted to try something different, not the usual burgers we can get anywhere. Finally decided on the turkey burger and the peanut butter burger for both of us to share. They once again came out very quick. The peanut butter was interesting,  not my favorite as it was caked on and made my mouth stick together. It overpowered the entire hamburger and other toppings. I tried scraping some off to no avail. Oh well, the point was to try something new so at least now I can say I've had peanut butter and bacon jam on a burger!  The turkey burger was delicious.  Loads of flavor, a tad dry but that's usually the case with turkey and the sauce evened it out. My favorite part of the meal was by far the fries! Hot, crispy,  perfectly seasoned. We tried the string and steak fries and both were great but my favorite were the string. Overall it was a cool place to come but the bland appetizer and the server brought it down a star. Maybe if I could give half a star I'd go to 3 1/2!

It's Vegas after all so the prices were comparable to other casual sit down type restaurants.  After complaining that 3/4 of our trip the service in Vegas seems to have really taken a nose dive, from the hostess staff, cab drivers, concierge, etc.  This place was a refreshing change from that, the service was nice, the server was prompt and pleasant.  Now on to the food.  I'm a picky eater, and most things are usually just "ok".  My Filet was FANTASTIC.  A really great change from the just plain OK.  The Arugula looked more like a garnish however, putting together the great taste of the steak, swipe in the pesto sauce from the plate and the mystery horseradish type sauce in the ramekin, and the cool taste of the arugula and you I have just eaten what was probably the best bite of steak in my life.  We would have even returned the next day if we weren't headed back home.

Just like the feel of this place. The room has great lighting. Music is perfect. TV's everywhere. The food is so unpretentious but sophisticated simultaneously - if that's possible. Service is good too. My server Sara B as friendly, efficient and attractive. The beverage offerings are both "adventurous" and familiar at the same time - best of both worlds. 

Great experience here.
Overall OK...don't come in during late night happy hour or you get nothing but attitude from the bar staff. Had to beg to pay as they were more interested in talking.

Such an amazing dinner! I ordered the filet and let me tell you that it is hands down the best steak I've ever eaten here in Las Vegas. It literally melted in my mouth and was cooked to perfection. My baked potato was super great and had a wonderful cheese sauce! Next time I'm in Vegas I will be back!

A solid three stars maybe even four.  The three stars is because it's so overpriced but you are in Vegas.  Just saying.... $20 for a basic cheese burger is kinda silly to me.  Plus they charged an extra $1.50 just because my wife and daughter split one.  The burgers were really good though.  Cooked to order, large, with seasoned fries and all quite tasty.  Wife and daughter also ordered the drumsticks (which were like buffalo wings but actually just small drumsticks) and they liked them a lot.  The service was friendly, the atmosphere was nice but I wouldn't need to come back as it's just too expensive for what you're getting (but that's Vegas).

Ton of beers, great appetizers. Plus Micheal Mina was there while we were. Thought that was pretty cool, considering it was 2pm on a Thursday. 

Great beer specials, try the Nachos. Seriously.

Just had our wedding dinner here last Friday (3pm)!!!!  They did a great job accomodating our group of about 20. The service was great.  The food was delicious.  

We didn't make a reservation.  Didn't have to wait.  It was perfect!!!

I ordered the 1842 burger and my husband got the rib eye. The place is comfortable and not too loud.
Amazing happy hour drinks and food.  The Korean ribs on happy hour menu is awesome.  Pretty much everything is excellent.  Brisket and nachos are very tasty.  Didn't care for drumsticks

This place is awesome.  Everything you want in a pub during Monday Night Football.  Cute waitresses, beer and cocktail specials, beer taps at the table, tasty food selection and lots of great Belgian beer.  Hey, since going to Belgium over the summer, I really crave this stuff.  Cool spot.

I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars on this one.  We tried this new Mina spot last night with high hopes.  Unfortunately, it was really nothing special.  After reading the previous post I was very much looking forward to dining here and I was excited to try the fried pickles but at 8:30 they were already sold out.  Our server recommended the lobster corn dogs so we gave them a shot.  He also recommended the crab cakes and the tuna starter.  The tuna poke was great quality and well prepared but we were not crazy about the lobster dogs or the crab cake.  I asked the server what kind of crab it would be and he said lump crab meat.  I asked what kind of crab and he didn't seem to know.  He agreed when I suggested 'blue crab?' I'm not sure what it was but it it didn't seem like lump blue crab meat.  
For our sides we tried the mac and cheese, mushrooms, and corn on the cob.  The corn was the winner. 
Entrees: fish and chips- the fish looked great but it covered the fries completely in the basket and created a steaming effect that made the fries soggy. Also, the fish and or batter didn't seem to be salted or seasoned at all which was a bummer.
Seared tuna- slightly over cooked but tasty
Turkey burger- good, not amazing- but good, especially if you like spicy.

If you want a hip sportsl bar environment with average bar food Pub 1842 is a good spot but if you are a foodie expecting a little extra from Michael Mina I would suggest trying one of his other restaurants or give this one some time to work out the kinks before you visit.

Came with Vegas with a large group and we wanted to eat together in our hotel and thought this place sounded good and could accommodate a reservation for 12 at the time we wanted. Our server was awesome, the table was in a prime location (in the front of the restaurant aka prime people watching), the food was delicious and the drinks were amazing. We had a variety of burgers and apps; everyone was satisfied with their meal. The best part of the whole thing...kings cup rules on the placemats!! You can ask for a deck of cards and they let us stay to drink and play for an hour after our meal. I would totally come back to this restaurant and eat again.

We went here for a "cheaper" dinner option.  I got the double burger with fries and a beer, the person I was with also got a burger and a beer.  We both did a 33 oz beer.  The whole thing came in at about 70 bucks which seemed like a lot for burgers but it was cheaper than most of the other dinner fare.  Perfectly respectable burgers if you're looking to stay in the eating areas of MGM, if you do a little traveling, you might be able to get more bang for your buck.  The person who served us was quick and friendly...

Spendy, but you pay for the location. Got the soft pretzel appetizer. They were really good. Only lightly salted, and not greasy. My wife got the nachos, which were just O.K. I got the champ burger, which was a good burger, but not $19 good. Add two beers to that and we spent over $60 for a burger and nachos. 

I do have to say the service was excellent, and if anything got me to go back that would be it.

I wasn't expecting too much coming here since it is a gastropub and there are tons of such places on the strip. Every casino has very similar restaurant offerings and after having a most disappointing experience at Burger Bar the night before I feared I was in for similar here.

Not the case.

We really enjoyed our experience at 1842. We had two appetizers and two 17oz drafts (I had the MOA pale ale and she had the (NAME ESCAPES US) porter). The food was an order of their pretzels and cheese w/ poached egg. This was AMAZING. I could have eaten it all night. The second appetizer we had were the nachos which had a sweet corn salsa on top. This too was amazingly good.

After our nosh we went out and did a little gambling and then returned in about an hour to have another drink at the bar. I revisited the MOA and she asked the bartender if she could make her a chocolate martini. The bartender answered in a half-hearted "sure" and proceeded to make a watered down, non-garnished mixed drink for $12. She had over-shaken the drink, thus making it very watery (rookie mistake). Ok, this was the ONLY thing that sucked about our experiences. For that kind of cash add some damn flare to the drink. It is not beyond reason to garnish with some chocolate shavings or syrup.

So, despite the lackluster mixed drink everything was awesome. They lose a star on the drink, but retain 4 strong stars and a promise that we will return in the near future. If you are a fan of beer and tasty-twists on pub fare favorites this place is for you.

*UPDATE*

I am going back and giving this place 5 stars.
