My wife and I revisited 1842 the next night for a snack and a nightcap. After a day of playing pinball and visiting Old Vegas we thought a revisit was needed. We were glad we went back.

The wifey ordered a Guinness and I had another MOA, both were 17oz and ice cold delicious. We then ordered the pretzels and cheese dip w/ poached egg, again. Absolutely awesome. It was satisfying and set us in the right mode to get some rest (pinball is a vicious sport).

We were quite fortunate to get our server from the first night, Juan O. A great guy that is very accommodating. Props.

OK, that's it. I think you get it and should give this place a try if in the neighborhood.

My friend and I went for lunch after arriving to Vegas from a 5 hour east to west coast flight.  We were hungry and wanted something that would fill us for the day.  Burgers . . . OK!  I had the pre-fix which is a great deal - any burger, a beer, fries and a cookie for $21 - the burgers alone are $16 each.  It is Vegas after all and that prices is not bad.  The burgers are unique for sure.  I had the crunchy peanut butter with ruffled potato chips, bacon jam and pimento cheese and subbed a turkey patty (no beef please).  I loved it, it was different and while I wouldn't do it often it was stick to your ribs tasty.  My friend had a beef burger with truffle and mushroom and loved it except for the bun.  The buns were not that special even though they toast them.  They might have been a little stale except for the toasted part which was sad because the bun can make or break the burger experience.  My bun was meh too.  The fries were nothing special as well, dry, skinny and unappealing - boooooo.  Fix that - fries should leave you wanting more not walking away from a full basket.  I think they call them bbq fries which simply means they put a dry rub sprinkle on them which to me did not enhance or take away from the fries.  The staff was friendly and it was not crowded so they checked on us often.  Enjoy!

I was out on a special occasion and decided to choose Michael Mina Pub 1842 for dinner that night.
I had an amazing time and it was a great experience.
Everything went perfect from start to finish.
I was told about this restaurant and had great expectations going in and all of those expectations were fulfilled.
My waitress was Marissa. 
She took such great care of us. She really took the whole experience over the top.
She was polite, friendly, out going and always made sure we were happy customers. Ask for Marissa if you want the BEST service and guest experience at the Pub.
It was great and when I come back again, i'm definitely asking for her.
The atmosphere, the food, and the whole experience that night exceeded was perfect.

Waking up at 11am in Vegas leaves little for the imagination when it comes to food. We still wanted breakfast, but also wanted to make it to the pool so we could find lounge chairs! We figured walking through the MGM on the way to the pool we'd find SOMETHING, but to no luck. Pub 1842 was our only option, and even they didn't open until 11:30.

We were the second customers to get in, and we sat at the bar for faster service. Although our bartender didn't know a lot about the breakfast menu, we picked something quickly. We ordered the Andouille sausage sandwich, which he told us came with fries.

We were very pleasantly surprised. The sandwich was so good! The bread used was like a thin version of Texas toast, without all the carbs. It was delicious, and almost melted in your mouth. The fries served with the sandwich were also amazing! They were heavily seasoned, with something like a general seasoning salt, but they were delish! 

I would definitely come back for that sandwich. We shared it between the two of us and we couldn't even make a dent in the fries.

Went on Valentine's Day and had  Fedex'd cards for wife. They had the first one waiting when we got to the table and then brought another out with each course. Our waiter Jaime was fantastic and so professional. They all made our dinner wonderful! Will make this a regular stop every time we are in Vegas. Thank you so much for a great meal!

Great food and great cold beer.  Went twice on annual buddies golf trip to Vegas.  Service slow but extremely friendly first night; second night much faster and still friendly.  Started both nights with nachos. As would be expected at a Michael Mina restaurant they were a major step above standard fare. Perfect blend of sweetness and spice in the corn, chili, jalapeños and house made cheese created the best nachos we've ever had. 1842 burger is a must. Delicious blend of caramelized onions, sautéed mushrooms and truffle aioli. The fish in the fish and chips melted in your mouth; incredibly fresh fish with a very light tempura batter. Pasta, kale Caesar salad and ahi also were big hits with the fellas.  Chef Mina was in the restaurant both nights. Very friendly and approachable. This has made our "must visit on next trip" list.

Great setting.   Lots of tvs.  Good beers and some creative cocktails.   Try the nacho libre If you like tequila drinks.   Great place to catch a Monday night game if you can get a seat at the bar...   But I'm sure you could see the tvs from any table there.   Our bartender was awesome.   Never got her name though... Short skinny brunette.   Prices are reasonable.   Happy Hour pricing is great. Food was solid.
Really enjoyed the dinner here. Can share nachos and a drink with friends or have double smoked bacon burgers for a meal. If you're game do both!

We stopped by Pub 1842 mid day for pre-dinner cocktails. The bartenders and manager on staff were great; engaging, perfect with drink recommendations, and quick. We had several cocktails and beers between the four of us and were quite hungry with several hours before dinner reservations. We ordered the soft pretzels with cheese fondue. The cheese has a poached egg in the middle which at first we were a little nervous about, but oh my word! SO GOOD! The cocktails we had were the punch, their take on a manhattan, and an old fashioned. Each one was perfectly balanced. We will certainly be heading back here on our next trip to Vegas for March Madness!!

Came here for pre-dinner appetizers!

Moscow Mules - Delicious, and delightfully gingery.

Duck Spring Rolls -
The manager said this was a must, so a must we must have :) I could have eaten about 5 more! Even those who do not like duck....admitted defeat to the tasty spring rolls.

Green Chile Verde -
Been hunting for this all around town. SO good!

1842 Nachos -
Too full to try, but I heard, they're the best nacho's someone has had in their life! They also come out in gigantic servings like on a cookie sheet!

Coconut Cake -
I didn't even get to try this because SOMEONE ate it all and didn't pass it down.

Clean restaurant with nice size tables and booths. I went there with my wife yesterday for dinner and enjoyed the BBQ pulled pork and brisket. The St Louis ribs I had in my sampler and my wife also had as her meal, were tender and tasty, but needed the tangy BBQ sauce to be delicious enough to really enjoy. I had cornbread with my meal, which was darn good, too.

Let me start off by saying that I wanted to come here based on the yelp reviews and photos. All the small plates looked delicious but apparently are only available at the bar!!!  
Shouldn't it be the other way around small plates available everywhere and large plates only available at booths and tables. Whatever, I decided to take a look at the menu anyway because I was starving. We came in around 3-4pm on a Sunday, it was EDC weekend so everywhere was pretty crazy. Our waiter was nice, patient and helpful. We all ordered water, beer and drinks. 

I ordered a michelada because I came here one other time but we sat at the bar and the girl that made our michelada made is spicy and delicious. This time it wasn't. All I tasted was Clamato  
We all went on to order food. We got the following: 

Nachos- Huge plate, they were shared with the whole table. They had pork, guac, sour cream, beans pico de gallo and cheese. Probably the best plate. 

BBQ drumsticks- We ordered 2 of these thinking "Oh we can share with everyone" WRONG!!!! The order only came with 3 and they were served with blue cheese. GROSS

Beef Brisket- not the greatest. It tasted microwaved. The corn bread was good though. Beans were ok but not enough to finish them

Overall, I consider this meal to have been a waste of calories. I really want to come back and try the small plates because they look delicious.

Thanks for ruining my Vegas trip. I came in last night and ordered a double smoked bacon burger. I've spent all morning puking and in the bathroom. I'm now dehydrated and feeling awful. I realize you guys are busy this weekend, but that's still no excuse to serve food that can compromise my immune system. Not good!

Stopped here on a whim looking for a quick meal. The food was amazing. I had the cheddar bacon burger. It was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Highly recommend it. One of the best burgers I've ever had. My wife had a filet mignon. Again, excellent. A great steakhouse quality steak from a burger bar. She let me have a small piece. Top notch. The service was great. Fast, friendly waitress. Great atmosphere. I would definitely eat here again.
Horrible place. We went there for vacation to Las Vegas. Took 30 min to get a drink. Last place in MGM i would recommend going to. Rude.

Overall great experience, although a bit pricy for what I would consider bar food. That being said everything we tasted had great flavor and the portions were large. Tempura mushrooms and oysters were delicious. Burgers and BBQ platter were very tasty. Loved the kale slaw! The service was very friendly and attentive. We went on a quiet night so we we're looked after very well. Overall a great experience and I recommend going!

Loved the food and drinks here. We started with cocktails. I did The Kicker and hubs did The Quarterback. Both super tasty.  Appy was the nachos.  Half portion is still big. Not shy on the size. Super good. Lots of toppings. Like the ratio to chips - amazing!  For din I had the Pub flatiron steak. Unreal. Cooked to perfection and seasoned fantastic. Hubs had the shrimp and grits. Again, fantastic. Perfect portions too. No doggie bag needed. Great atmosphere. Great service. We were not disappointed at all. Would visit again.

Having time to kill before our concert over the weekend, a group of us decided to give Pub 1892 a shot. They offer a happy hour in the bar area every day, but unfortunately there were not seats in the bar area so we just decided to take a booth. They offer all the happy hour drink specials outside the bar, so we were still happy and the menu wasn't too expensive for the quick bite we were hoping for.

We settled in and decided to share an order of nachos and the lobster corndogs. We got some drinks as well and they were pretty good. The nachos came out quickly and they were enormous. We had every intention on ordering a few more items to share but after the nachos we were pretty full. The lobster corndogs came out and they were ok. My fella and mom didn't enjoy them at all so I ended up having to take the brunt of this dish. It was enjoyable, but pretty greasy.
Definitely better to share  most of these dishes. Most of the entrees that came out for neighboring tables were pretty sad looking. Tiny portions and the food didn't look or sound very exciting. The highlights from the menu really seemed to be the appetizers which were on the more creative side as well as the burgers that were a good portion size for the price. 

The piña colada was really the only good cocktail we tried and actually enjoyed, but with an extensive beer assortment, this is the preferable thing  to order here.

I was debating between three and four stars, but based on the food we ordered alone I will stick with three until I give this place another try. I won't go out of my way to try this place again, but it's a solid choice if you're in the area for a show or vacation.

So this is the almighty Micheal Mina, the chef I have heard so much about since the new Levi's Stadium has opened? 

SO why is it his 20 dollar cheeseburger - yes, even though it is Vegas, who has the balls to charge 20 bucks for a cheeseburger - isn't half as good as my local bar's 9 dollar one? Not in any category. 

The meat was tasteless and dry, even though they did cook it medium rare. And bacon jam was so awful and overpowering you could still taste it after scraping it off. 

This just confirms my theory - famous chefs do not have anything to do with these Vegas restaurants, at best they help design the menu, slap their name on it and cash checks until it closes.

Ordered the kale ceasar salad with chicken.
Meal arrived and it looked good.....until i took a bite out of the wing section and got a mouth full of raw bloody chicken. I notified the server who took the piece to the kitchen manager. His answer was "that the breast section was cooked just not the part near the bone, because it doesn't touch the grill" - WTF is that supposed to mean, i said. No answer just a dumb look.. Eat here at your own risk. Horrible experience. 
Stay away!!!

I love a good pub burger, so when one comes along as strange as the peanut butter crunch burger I order it.  I hope if you try it that it's as good as the one I had.  No, It isn't right.  Yes it is different.  Creative? Yes.  Delicious?  I say hell yes.  The crunchiness of the ridged potato crisps meld with the bacon jam to trick your buds into thinking you're monching into crisp bacon.  Was there for lunch when it was a bit more tamed down.  Decent enough atmosphere, and friendly staff.  I'd do it again.

Round 3 and 4 of coming here were great experiences. My husband got another burger with fried avacado and mango on it. It was pretty tasty. There was tons of different flavors happening. My husband looooooved. It has a slight char flavor to it as well. I got the trout which I thought was cooked absolutely perfectly. The shocking part, they kept the skin on!!! I was pleasantly surprised because it gave it a nice texture and flavor. The salad that came with it was also great. A little tangy and a little sweet/salty all in one. Finally, we got the rum bread pudding. This might be a seasonal special but it's pretty darn good. It has raisins which I didn't think I would like but it's pretty darn good.

Awesome Happy Hour with great crafted cocktails ( barrel aged old fashion, the Heist, the Kramer, their Cuban summer) and delish small plates. We tried the Korean BBQ ribs, the lobster grilled cheese with fries, the duck spring roll, the brisket sliders, and the chopped wedge salad. Fabulous food and prices were great off the happy hour menu which runs 4-7 pm. Soo good I am returning for a 3rd time this visit. Service at the bar on the food is great, cocktail service by the bartenders a bit slow. What a great value!

This is Michael Mina at his casual best!  An American pub;  Skeptical poker buds and I walk in ready to be insulted but were pleasantly surprised.  Straight to it, the food.

Remember, Mina is a master of seafood; namely lobster so...

There back!  Lobster corn dogs.  Incredibly sweet chunks of perfectly cooked lobster in a crispy, fluffy, semi sweet corn dog coating with a tangy whole grain mustard and crème fraiche.  Simply put, good eats.

Other starters such as the duck spring rolls with ginger chili dipping sauce, mint and cilantro (excellent with the earthy flavor of moist duck accented by a decent "Asian" dipping sauce that brings forth the flavor of the oily duck meat and a great, light, crisp tempura or maitake mushrooms in a soy, scallion dipping sauce are excellent.  As with all Mina's restaurants, try what sounds different.  While not authentic Asian, still very good flavors.

For larger plates, the Lobster roll with jalapeno creamed corn is excellent.  It's not Northeast authentic but who cares.  Rich, perfectly cooked lobster in a crisp, buttery roll surrounded by a very spicy creamed corn.  The flavor of the jalapeno brings a rich chili taste that contrast well with the sweet, cold water lobster.  The Korean BBQ salmon burger is also good eats.  Soy marinated, cooked medium, and accompanied by cucumber kimchi and ginger aioli is incredibly well balanced.  Complex texture.  Simply delicious.

Great pub style service.  Friendly and correct.

Nice selection of craft cocktails and infusions.  Solid but not too creative beer list.  OK wine list.  Vegas resort pricing.

A worthy replacement for Seablue.

Customer Service Lesson 101: Incompetent Hostess Lost a Customer

I went to Michael Mina's Pub at the MGM for a late lunch (about 1:30 PM) and was offered a choice of table or bar seating. I requested a table because I needed a little space to complete some work. Yet, I was escorted to the noisier and less comfortable bar area and offered a small "highchair" style table that was very cramped. This wasn't what I had in mind when originally offered a table vs bar seating.

Looking around, I saw many empty regular tables and politely requested one of those instead. I was told all the tables were reserved for lunch and unavailable and that I'd have to wait at least 15 minutes to sit down. At 1:30, it was after the prime lunch crowd. It wasn't that busy and it seemed odd that all the tables would be reserved at that hour. I pointed out that there were a lot of empty tables and again requested one of them. Annoyed at the lack of effort to find a solution, it went downhill from there, and I ultimately decided to find another spot where I could have lunch.

I ended up eating in the food court adjacent to Michael Mina's where there were plenty of open tables. Upon completing my lunch at 2:15 (about 45 minutes after I first went to Michael Mina's), I was amused to see several vacant tables at Michael Mina's. including those supposed "reserved" tables that sat empty, just as they were when I had first arrived.

I don't dispute that some tables may have been reserved, but I doubt all of them were reserved for lunch at that hour. The restaurant appeared to be at 50% capacity. But it was more the lack of attempt to retain a customer, or say, "Let me see what I can do." Instead, the hostess let a first-time customer walk out the door, possibly losing a customer for life. There is way too much competition and choice. Restaurants need to hire, train, and empower their personnel to use a little common sense. Sadly, this is increasingly rare. Hence, my 2-star review is based on a poor service experience only and not the quality or taste of the food, which I never had an opportunity to try.

Stopped in for drinks and appetizers.  The beers were huge and the atmosphere was cool, but 1 - fried pickles were all wrong, don't make them with spears and don't use tempura batter! The batter fell off and they should be like chips to quickly eat.  I had red wine, wasn't in the mood for beer or a mixed drink and they served it cold.  Not cool or room temp, but cold like white wine, um no. :) the people I was with liked their beer the other food smelled good and I would like for it to be good, so I would try it again and steer clear of fried pickles and wine! Lol :)

Try to make it to happy hour before six pm. $6 wines (instead of 16) and cocktails (instead of $12) with $4 beers. 
1842 Burger was good. Mushrooms were nicely sauteed. 
Nachos: other than a claim to fame for being utterly ginormous, the toppings were all mushed together with indistinguishable elements. I scraped most of it off and just ate the chips with the melted cheese. my bf enjoyed them a lot more though, and thought they were sloppy goodness. definitely prepare to share this between 3-4 people.

I was hesitant to go here because of the yelp rating. But I'll tell you right now this place had the best food I had on my trip to Vegas this week. All the beer signs are fun, I sat at the bar top, the bartender was nice and knowledgeable of his beers on draft which is a plus for me.  Had the kale salad and the salmon burger they were both delicious... I had a great time here and definitely went for a second time before I left Vegas, everything else I had the second time was delicious as well but that salmon  burger is something else, I'm still thinking about it.

I will definitely go back on my next visit.
Impeccable service. Good burgers! Great options. Went here for lunch today and was surprised to find such a gem of a restaurant. Sara, our waitress and her busboy paid attention to all the details.

Looks can be deceiving. It looks like your run-of-the-mill casino restaurant but they have an extensive bourbon and scotch menu. In fact, the best scotch in the world, Auchentoshan three wood, because it's aged in a bourbon barrel and the best bourbon,  Rowan's Creek because it's aged in a bourbon barrel. Very impressed and the bartender Liz is amazing. Really enjoyed this place. A hidden Vegas gem, the real deal.

Kudos to the cool guys at the bar!   We wanted a casual lunch that included a burger!   After mistaking a 'shrooms' burger for a hamburger with mushroom at Shake Shack, I wanted to make sure I had some real meat in my next Vegas burger.

Location is in the MGM Grand, and there is seating indoors, at the bar, and inside.

Pub 1842 has a huge variety of pub grub.   We opted for their prix fix lunch to include cocktails...bargain for what we got!   My meal included a choice of any of their signature burgers, and yes, I selected the 1842, carmelized onions, mushrooms, truffle aioli and a choice of sides, and I selected the seasoned BBQ french fries.   Both items were HUGE.   My lunch also included a 'boozy shake', and I chose a Vanilla Shake with Vanilla Vodka.  That was amazing.   

Their food was large in portion and tasty too.   Service by our great bartenders was exceptional.   They made sure we had our food in a timely manner.
Hands down the best turkey burger I've ever had.  Great vibe. What some college football at a burger and the staff chatted and were very attentive. Food came out fast and it was delicious.

Perfect spot for happy hour. I love their cocktails--had the Heist (Bulleit bourbon, passion fruit-lemongrass syrup, vanilla, and fresh lemon juice, with fresh cracked black pepper on top), which was sweeter than I normally go for, but interesting and delicious. They had a special version with strawberry peppercorn syrup as well, and that one was tasty, too. They do barrel-aged cocktails, which is an interesting concept, but the only one I tried was way too sweet for me (Sin City, with Buffalo Trace whiskey, Green Chartreuse, keffir lime syrup, and a gold leaf garnish). The Soda Popinski from the Fizzy-Lifting section of the menu (their version of a Moscow Mule--Grey Goose, fresh lime, ginger beer), was refreshing and balanced.

As far as food, the 1842 nachos were fantastic! They're cheaper during happy hour, and a ridiculously large serving--an entire tray of tortilla chips with big chunks of braised pork, cheddar cheese sauce, black bean and jicama relish, with pickled fresno peppers. Super flavorful.

Love this place for happy hour!

You know, now being a local, people question why we still venture to eat out on The Strip. But when we find spots like this, it reinforces the fact that there are some great and fun places to experience!
We had a BLAST here and really enjoyed our meal! The burgers were AWESOME! So meaty, so tender, so full of flavor. Their apps are equally fun and great! The fries are AWESOME!
And if you're a sports fan, they got you covered! The place is LINED with TV's in every angle and position you are seated in. Just keep in mind, if you want a spot to eat and talk and hear the conversation, don't go. But, if you want great burgers, sports TV and a GREAT time? GO!
Oh and our service was CRAZY fun and awesome!!!

Had a very delicious lunch here upon arrival in LV. Had the greens salad and added salmon. The salmon was seasoned perfectly-full of bright flavor and cooked perfectly. That salad was set off by a light but delightful dressing. I could eat that salad 50 more times! We also ordered the tuna sandwich-blue fin tuna! The sandwich was classic, yet not ordinary. They were very gracious about splitting everything for the hubs and I with no extra charge. It was a memorable meal. I was surprised because we were eating in a "pub" but this is really a great restaurant.
Happy hour sliders were delicious. $4 for a sprite seems like a lot but hey, it's vegas!
Crazy yummy brunch menu!  Great place to hang.  Food was awesome, serves quick, and service was top notch!

meh... the food was not as great as what the reviews rave about. perhaps because i ordered a steak taco salad and it tasted like they smoosh 1million taco shells into it.. meh! the salad dressing tasted like ass. ASS i tell you. and it was pretty pricey. meh!

Steak was fantastic
Beer selection was very good 
Services was very good. 
Located in a great casino

Enjoyed the turkey burger and substituted the fries with a salad and their house dressing. Pretty good. Washed it down with a cold Stella. A person in the group got the pulled pork burger and said it was just okay - nothing great. Overall, great atmosphere, good service and food.
I walked through the door of this establishment and was promptly buttf***ed Good salad though.

Just finished a show and walking by needing to eat. Stop in and was seated fast.  The three of us picked different items.  Two different burgers medium and BBQ pork.  All three arrive super quick.  The burgers were overcooked.  The drys were outstanding.  The BBQ pork had no flavor and was dry with hard override cooked pieces.  Completely disappointed and have back.  The nose level was terribly loud.  I would never go back again.  $18 to $20 burgers and BBQ should be prefect!  These were not.
Delicious burgers, great beer, and the perfect place to watch a game...what more could you want?

Service 5 Stars.    Food. 5 Stars.   Price. 3.5 stars.   My husband and I got a burger and nachos to share.   Plenty of food, by the way!  We both drank water as the beer was a little pricey.  We live in Vegas and just wanted to try something different.  Our bill was $38. Without the tip.  We expected it...but $9 beer is a bit much.    We will go back!

one of the best eateries we've had in Vegas - and this is from food that was taken to-go and eaten the next 2 days!!!

- Lobster corn dog: just ok.  They give you 3 mini dogs, but since it was ok ,aybe because it was to-go?
- St. Louis Ribs: Fantastic
- 1842 Burger: Fantastic. When a burger is amazing after 1 day, its says alot.  When it is amazing the 2 day after twice heating it up, it speaks to the quality
- Double Bacon burger: Good. My daughter liked it. I thought it was a bit dry, but still good. 
- Rib eye steak: Fantastic!

Price - vegas pricing standards.  $17-$20 for the burgers with fries.  The steak was like $45, ribs was $34 for the full stack.  Would I come again? You bet ya!
Great happy hour and food. Relaxed atmosphere with all the sports on TV my husband could wish for!

Very good place to eat. The staff is very friendly and not pushy to get you to order. Had the double smoked bacon burger that I recommend to anybody. That was about one of the best burgers I ever had hands down. The restaurant was clean and the only reason I gave this restaurant a 4 instead of a 5 is the price. A bud light 12 ounce draft was 16.00 each. I will each here on my next trip but I will not be drinking the beer is way too expensive.

I love the PUB at Crystal's, this place is semi yuck.  Brown sugar on fries!  Yeah, WTF and barf.  Drinks were good.  My dad had to bribe the hostess to sit where he could see the TV.  A manager did come quickly to resolve our complaint.  Servers were all fabulous.   Food was just too eccentric.

Nachos and brussel sprouts are good. Thick cuts of bacon were are added to the brussel sprouts and that was packed flavor. 'The Champ" voted as MGM's best burger is juicy and delicious. The "Little of Evertything," was a bit dry side & they provide extra bbq sauce on the side, though jalopeno corn bread was tasty. I'm a fan since this spot seem to be pretty chilled and relaxing, have a wide range of beer on tap, and might be the only place in MGM that have serves gourmet burgers without having the feeling to be dressed up.

We were a group of six that dined here on Saturday, October 24, walking in without a reservation.  Enroute from Bryce/Zion and home to CA.  Extremely impressed with dining at Mina's "Stonehill Tavern" at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach, CA recently.  All the entrees, from the burger to the ribs were enjoyed by all!  No complaints, even from our most critical diner in the group.  Due to sensitivity to black pepper and most of the proteins there are "pre-seasoned", the chef offered a deliciously grilled salmon, absolutely delicious side of brussels sprouts, and a huge side of fries, lightly salted!  The willingness and flexibility to accommodate special diets were notable.  Our server was extremely efficient and friendly.  The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is because of the "special dish" I had was billed at $29, when the quote at ordering was $25.  We definitely will return to this establishment (among so many other choices in LV) to dine when we are in Vegas again and I do expect to raise my rating to 5 stars!

A decent pub located at the MGM.  Cool concept, but the service wasn't what I expected, we'd enjoy our meal, but we barely saw our server, which delayed our indulgence of the place.  At the end of the day, if the service was better I would have guaranteed to have come back; but it wasn't, and so I'm sure there's other places in Vegas to spend my money.

Ok.. Let me start off by saying their sliders and fries are AMAZING!!!! Best I have ever ever had!!!! That being said... The service was terrible!!!! It was pretty slow, and yet we received horrible service! The bar tender had a major attitude. Took our food orders without bothering to ask what we wanted to drink and hello we sat AT the bar!! He never once asked if we needed anything else. Instead stood there talking to other bar tenders. We waiting probably 20 min just to get anyone's attention to ask for our check! I would def come back for the amazing food but maybe try getting a table with an actual waiter!

Going through my receipts from our MGM Las Vegas stay 9/8-9/11...looks as if we made an appearance here at least once a day.  We ate/drank at the bar each time.  They are hustling behind that bar...busy, busy, but not too busy to be nice.  Our server the first two times was Amanda.  She kept a good eye on us and gave great service. Our third time two different guys waited on us, our receipt says "Bill" - they were great.   I like that they have hooks to hang your purse on at the bar.  My husband liked the multiple televisions with sports on (although his Packers lost...boo!).   He also liked their beer selection. They are happy to put your drink in plastic cup to go if you have to be headed somewhere else.   When I think pub food, I think heavy, greasy, and fried...(nothing against that, but we were there for an event and wanted our evening clothes to fit when we put them on).  We ordered the Crab Louis deviled eggs on 2 different days.  They are delicious and served on little bib lettuce leaves.  They put the eggs on a little bit of the stuffing so that they don't slide around.  That little bit of egg, wrapped up in the bib lettuce, was a nice little bonus.  We shared a wedge salad and had them add steak ($12 extra). The salad was really good.  The big chunks of bacon were to die for!  I asked if they made a BLT w/ that bacon - our server said only on Sunday and Monday brunch - so we had missed out.  A must-try next time.  We ordered a lobster roll to share the next time.  I always thought a lobster roll was on a roll or a hoagie type bread.  This came on toasted, sandwich type bread.  It was really good, just not what I pictured.  They had it split in two for us since they knew we were sharing.  They are attentive on making sure each person has their own plate when sharing, and also attentive making sure there were napkins (cloth) and silverware as needed.  This was a fun place to hang out and I would definitely go back.

Perfect place to enjoy happy hour before a show.  Easily found seats at the bar...friendly service and we enjoyed $7 HH cocktails, 2 small plates (sliders and lobster grilled cheese), and the nachos.  The cocktails were delicious and priced right during happy hour.  Food was all good, especially the fries that came with the lobster grilled cheese.  As other Yelpers have mentioned, the nachos were AWESOME!  The nachos portion is HUGE...order this and it's enough for two hungry big appetite people!
Services is awful.  We waited for 5 minutes for table. Once seated, waited 20 minutes and never got to order or get drinks or water. Michael Mina should remove his name from this disappointment.

Great place to relax and enjoy some great food at a reasonable price. I personally recommend the rack of ribs, and the squash. The ribs fell right off the bone and had a great flavor. The squash was caramelized with brown sugar. A great treat. The drink special was a champagne with cognac that was just what you needed. The staff was extremely polite and ensured everything was exactly what we needed.
We took longer to order food than it took to come out, and it was amazing. Complimented by a selection of good beers, color me impressed.

We found Pub 1842 walking thru the District, after having read some of the reviews here.  It did not disappoint!! 

I had the Champ Burger, that was utterly amazing!  We sat at the bar, and the service was fantastic too.  Jennifer was amazing, had great suggestions and was a fun bartender!!  (thanks again, Jennifer)

The atmosphere was great too.  Two big TVs above the bar, great stools, etc.

Came in to try 9.99 special  they're  advertising.I had the steak  which  was a little bit more. The steak  was tuff. I think  shoe leather tastes way better and I've never  eaten  shoe leather but it probably  has a better  taste.I wouldn't  recommend  the the chicken  pasta dinner  either. But overall  the root beer  wasn't  bad. The service  was great , And the restaurant  was clean.

24 DIFFERENT TYPES OF (GOOD) BEER ON TAP. Order your beer in a 33 oz. stein and watch yourself get supperrrrr drunk. 

If you've been drinking already, like I was, I ended up getting too drunk to finish my beer. Our lovely bartender handed me a plastic cup and I took the rest of my beer TO-GO! After all, you are in Vegas and wasting alcohol is blasphemy! 

I love the decor and vibe of this pub. Service was impeccable from what I remembered.

Thank you to Chelsea! She was a sweet heart and super funny! Best host I've met in a long time! I'm super picky when it comes to my food and our waiter(Will) was very supportive of my picky habits! Would come here again!

I can't think for the life of me what Michael Mina was thinking attaching his name to this  " pub". This was serviceable food at best and a marginally stocked bar wrapped in the guise of a pub. The food was ok and the service was ok all couched in the exaggerated LV price structure. The solution, mediocre.

Want a real LV pub experience? Try Gordon Ramsey's located in Caesar's. GR knows pub food!
The burgers are not very good. The buns have a terrible texture, way too fluffy. The neat was bland and the toppings were nothing special. The deviled eggs were tasty though.

The "A Bit of Everything BBQ Plate" was really satisfying. The weakest link on the plate being the Kale slaw which didn't really taste like anything. The slaw dressing was simply milky and lacked acid - like a weak Ranch dressing. Would've been way better with a vinegar-based formula. 

I was super impressed by the St. Louis-style BBQ ribs on the Bit of Everything plate. Lean like baby backs, and robust-tasting like Texas beef ribs, I really enjoyed them. I agree with Cathy C - way better than Rollin' Smoke, and even better than the former Las Vegas Grille as well - that's saying a lot, I think! Seriously, if you were to tell me that these were just a large, delicious version of a baby back rib, I would believe it.

The brisket was great as well. Pretty smoke ring and great flavor. The fat was totally edible and had a true melt-in-your-mouth quality. Pulled pork was delicious, and the baked beans were served piping hot (which I appreciate) and tasted homemade.

I had a dozen oysters on the side - East Coast (Bluepoint, I believe), jumbo-sized and moderately priced at $3/pop. Good luck finding them for less coin on the Strip (at least these ones are huge.)

Overall I would put this place a cut above the Todd English and Gordon Ramsay Pubs, and on the same food par as Rx Boiler Room, but I believe Michael Mina 1842 wins on price point. One of the big drags about Gordon Ramsay and Michael Mina is the walking distance from the Self Park deck (about 12-14 mins). Even from the Valet it takes about 10 mins to walk to both places. But I guess a nice walk is good thing after a meal like this?

Ok, so I'm in Vegas 4-5 times a year and have eaten at many places in and around the strip.  Gotta say this place underperforms.  Sat at the bar at 5:30 and it took almost 10 minutes to place a drink order. Server was right in front of me and never made eye contact.  Finally another bartender checked in and took my order.   Had a burger and a few beers.   Had the namesake 1824 and I've had better for comparable prices.  But the bar service was just lacking. Place wasn't that busy and they all seemed preoccupied or just not focused in their customers.   Wouldn't recommend it.
The Brew Selection and Burgers are Bangin'. Ya gotta hit this spot when ya visit The LV.
The double smoked bacon burger is unreal!  It's a $20 burger and totally worth every penny!!  The smoke Gouda on the burger is delicious!  5 stars!

Showed up at 5pm on a Sunday night. There was a 30 min wait, so we just went to the bar. Service at the bar was good. Happy hour wine was $5. Qupe Syrah is always wonderful. But let us get to the food.

Got the Fish Tacos and Peanut Butter Crunch Burger. Burger was ordered medium, but came out medium well. The edges were charred, the burger slightly cracked and falling apart. The char would have been nice, if the center was a nice pink temp, but it was cooked all through to a muted brown. Flavor was good though. But for $19, there are better burgers to be had in Vegas.

The fish tacos came recommended by the bar tender. So we ordered those too. Wrapped in  standard grocery store tortillas, they were room temp and stale. They could not hold up to the filling inside, as they fell apart one bite into the taco. The fish and mushy, not flaky and tender. The soggy breading lacked much seasoning. Chef, these need to be taken off the menu! Or learn how to heat up corn tortillas and keep the fish crispy. At $24 for 3 tacos, look elsewhere.

I wasn't blown away by Michael Mina Pub while I stayed in MGM. There are so many options in Vegas, the bar is set pretty high. 

Came for a casual dinner with two girlfriends; the beer selection is easily 4 stars -- great beer in lots of sizes. The drinks were weak IMO, not well made, too sweet-and-sour-y and uninspired.

Ordered the wedge salad, it was good, but nothing to write home about. My friend got the peanut butter burger -- again, I enjoyed my nibble but I wasn't like, "OMG I NEED TO YELP REVIEW THIS RIGHT NOW". 

If you're staying at MGM, go here for beers, but you'll get better food at the crepe place near the food court, honestly.

Loved it! Service was great and fast even though they had a full house. The double smoked bacon burger is delicious and La Mula is the right amount of spicy. Came here by chance and will come again on purpose.

Michael Mina Pub 1842 was so good that we hit it twice on the the same trip. 

The beer selection was outstanding and our waiter was a fellow craft beer nut so we hit it off well.  All of his recommendations were right on point.  (Thanks Will!)

My wife ordered the PB&J burger and we were both blown away by the complexity of the flavors.  It was a crazy experiment gone incredibly right!  I had the BBQ platter and was very satisfied with my meal.

My review was lowered by one star due to the prices being a little on the high side.  This is the new Vegas standard and could go for nearly every restaurant in town.

Pub 1842 will be on our list of places to hit again when the gambling goes south.  Expensive or not, I would rather have a full gut and a head full of beer than watch my wallet get bled dry in the casino.

On the last day of EDC, the squad and I were torn between going to EDC early or watching the last game of the NBA finals between the Warriors and Cavs. Of course being from the Bay Area, we needed to prove our loyalty to Dub Nation. We were staying at the MGM Signature and needed a place with alcohol, food and televisions that were playing the game. Luckily, we found this spot which is conveniently located between MGM and The Signature. 
Upon entering, we were promptly seated and served. Though it is a little on the pricey side, the portions were massive! We got the spicy chicken sandwich, calamari and pulled pork sandwich. Our food was so satisfying and delicious. Though our dining experience was great, our spirits were crushed after Cleveland beat the Warriors for the championship. Overall, we'll definitely be back to watch Curry, Klay and KD take the championship back.

Was walking by and decided to stop in .. Pen was our server and she was great! She really knew what she was doing.. Food was awesome as well! I had the pulled pork sandwich and the fried cauliflower! Would definitely visit again!

The food was suberb, the bacon burger was out of this world.  It made my husbands top 3 burgers list (very impressive).  The service was hectic, the food came out slow, we had to ask for things more than once.  Would definitely return (on a slower night).

Tried the peanutbutter crunch burger. It was very good. Some detracting points on execution: unevenly cooked burger, unevenly spread toppings, and i forgot there was pimento cheese because I couldn't taste it. I ordered a chocolate malt shake and paid $9 for it, but I was never served the accompanying cake that goes with it.  Fix those and it gets another star.

It's a 3.5 for me....
Here's the short end of it:
1.  The menu is pricey--even the kid's menu.  
2.  The food is delicious (have the burger or pulled pork sandwich) and is prepared perfect.  Out of 13 entrees, every person in our party loved their meals.  
3.  The service is dependent on who you get. Over the course of a 7 day convention, we ate there 3 times. All the male servers were completely nice and friendly. All the female servers couldn't be bothered and kinda had chips on their shoulders.  We ignored it, but it was really noticeable all 3 times.  

I would definitely go back the next time we are at the MGM. It's great for happy hour and/or any sporting event!
The food is amazing here. The best damn nachos I've ever had. Mina delivers with bar food that'll blow your mind.

We came here for dinner, average price for dinner on the strip for 2 people. My husband loved the kale avocado salad, which is probably what I should have got! I got the falafel sandwich with tzatziki...meh. The sandwich was slightly overdone and the tzatziki didn't have much flavor. Instead of serving a plate full of french fries, maybe offer a salad or a different option for a starch. That would make this dish stand out from others. I would have rated this 3 stars, but the kale salad bumped it up to 4 stars.

Had lunch here with the wife while we waited for friends to arrive at MGM Grand.  This time, we split the BBQ "everything" plate.  This comes with beans, kale slaw, roasted squash, 4 ribs, a good amount of pulled pork, and some brisket.  The sides didn't do much for us, I thought the kale slaw was the best of the bunch.  But the meats were all fantastic.  The brisket had good bark on it and was juicy.  The ribs were tender but still adhered to the bone, which is exactly how I like them.  The sauce was sweeter than I usually like, but it worked.  Also, it had a little bit of spice to it.  This is a massive platter at $32, I think sharing is a great option.  I would definitely order this again, not ready to bump 1842 up a star, but it's getting closer to 4 stars certainly.

Makes it a good stop on the way to your show at MGM to get your buzz and dinner. I got a Manhattan and my wife got an Old Fashion and we shared a Mac'n Cheese. Fast, friendly service, lots of seating at the bar, good quick food and drinks.

Tried to get seated.. 2 people... At the bar 2 tops. Completely empty yet they wouldn't seat us. Instead we're told 20-30 minute wait. 
Horribly rude hostess... Not even an explanation why we couldn't be seated.

Was looking for a good place to enjoy a pretzel and Yelp app steered me to Pub 1842.  Thankfully I walked in just as happy hour begun.  $5 beers and some tasty snacks for under $10 bucks - I'm sold.  The pretzel was $11 bucks but I'd easily order it again.  The cheesy dipping sauce comes with an egg yolk in the middle so when you mix it together and dip your warm pretzel in it; YUM!  I also ordered the brisket sliders $8 and the smokey meat paired well with the sweet slaw.  I was a very happy man during this happy hour

Food was great but I'm rating the service. 

My friend and I sat at the bar. The bar staff was very lack luster. The only time they were engaging was when I asked which they should suggest: ribs or chicken and waffles. 

Other than that,  we were ignored until we had to flag down for a water refill and the check. The only redeeming bartender was this older bartender that actually noticed my water was empty and refilled it without having to be asked.

Other than that, I did not enjoy the bar. If the staff was friendlier and more engaging we definitely would have stayed for a second round. Don't sit at the bar. Sit at the tables. I actually was jealous that the servers were more engaging with their guests than the bartenders were.
Good beer and great nachos. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. I will definitely be back when I'm at the MGM.

ATMOSPHERE: 4 STars-Open concept, with center bar and back visible kitchen and crew.  We sat at the bar, great crowd and 'mood' in this place. 
SERVICE: 4 Stars- Fast, friendly, funny.  We had one main guy with another joining in when needed.  All the guys kept a good eye on the bar making sure everyone had good service.
FOOD: 0 Stars -Many dishes 'caught my eye' but we had eaten before hitting the bar.  I will definitely go back and have some of those yummy looking choices.
DRINKS: 4 Stars- My guy had many choices of beer 'dark' on tap and the bartender was quick to give samples, so he could pick his fav.
PRICE: 3 Stars (someday...Vegas will have bargains...Nah.. don't think so... cause we keep paying these prices )  two wines, two beers, a delicious mixed drink (Spanish Harlem) and a side of chips and salsa (non-menu) and no hesitation to provide my request...$75
I was happy, this was a good night and I think it will be a 'good find' for this local to return to.

I only gave it a 2 because they didn't mess up my Corona. Typical, Gut Fill type Sports Bar mutation that does not have to rely on repeat customers. 4 of us waited 25 minutes for a table, 20 more for a server, 40 more for food- some inedible, not sure what the deal was with the lobster dough balls or the nachos but spent $200.00 and 2 hours and chocked it off as an education......give the place less than a year...
Amazing food and super friendly, helpful and efficient waitresses. Drinks were great (loved the black cherries!) PB&J burger was amazing and Delish duck fat fries.

Came in for appetizers and drinks. The football game was on so it was happy hour and the drinks were reasonably priced for Vegas. The location is nice and the wait staff was pleasant. The nachos were excellent and huge! The calamari wasn't terrible but it tasted like they needed to change their frying oil.
Jennifer the bartender was fantastic! She made our visit very enjoyable. The Negronis are the best

Terrible Service! Mediocre food. Unexplainable because restaurant was mostly empty. Waited almost an hour for food after ordering and before that waited 20 minutes to put in a drink order.  Ribs were over-done, tasted as though they were microwaved - dry and chewy, did not fall off the bone. If you are at the MGM there are so many other, much better choices! Only reason I give two stars is the Peanut Butter Burger - unique and actual good.
Great burgers and a big choice for adult beverages and/or milk shakes. Good service too and nice atmosphere.

After eating food at the hotel from the mgm  we were so excited to FINALLY get real delicious tasty food!! This place has some really good burgers and fries. I got the double bacon burger I guess it has won in competitions and man I see why it won hahaha! The server was awesome as well! The beer tasted so good and crisp and they give you a cookie and oh man that chocolate cookie just melts in your mouth and very delicious yum I really enjoyed my time, Just writing this review is getting me hungry for that again hahaha. money well spent! Would I return? Heck yeah!

I've been to this place about 5 times during busy periods over the last year, and it's basically impossible to get a drink from the bartender unless you have a seat at the bar, and even THEN it's very hard. They are SERIOUSLY understaffed, and the bartenders are just barely civil. I'm not sure why the Michael Mina organization is okay with that, but apparently they are.
You'll be able to get a drink if you are at a table and ordering food. The food is good -- the hamburgers are well made and seasoned, and the salads are fresh and easily enough for 2 people. The waitstaff is hit or miss -- I had a very nice server the last time I was there (March 2015) who was friendly and professional. On my previous visit the server was clearly "over it" and could barely contain her eyerolls. Luck of the draw I guess.

I went today with my sister because she was dying to go while she was visiting from out of town. We walked in and were seated immediately. I loved the atmosphere, the mason jar water glasses, and the Kings Cup instructions on the place mats. The waitress was TOO friendly. I'm here visiting my sister from out of town trying to catch up with her and our waitress is telling me her life story. I could tell you where she's from, age, and how many kids she has and their ages. Anyway it was happy hour but they had such a random few of choices for beers and cocktails it turned us off for drinks completely and stuck with waters. Taking a look at the menu it was totally changed from what we saw online and nothing that we went there to try (like lobster corn dogs) were left, everything else didn't look as appealing as the previous menu. So we ordered the fried cauliflower that was good but came soggy and we were hoping for crispy since it was fried. The menu also described it as hot but it was extremely sweet like candy!! We decided to try something else so we ordered the brisket sliders next. The bun wasn't warm or really soft, I think the greens in them were kale which I didn't feel like it belonged, but the brisket itself was good but once again really sweet! At this point we weren't in the mood for dessert from all the sugar in what we already ate. The bill came in another mason jar and even though I had nothing to drink, I still almost put the check with my money into my water! Lol My rating is due to the sweetness, and everything that was just wrong about the food (but it wasn't bad! Just not good) and the fact that the happy hour drink menu as well as the regular menus just stunk compared to what we were originally excited for.

Walked in and there was an old fashioned feel to this place. Located inside the MGM Hotel and Casino, this place seemed like it was the hob-knob of hand craft beer heaven. 

Food portions here aren't ginormous, but the presentation is top notce and very filling. 

Food:

Lobster Corn Dogs
Shellfish Platter
1842 Burger - comes with caramelized onions, mushrooms,
blue cheese, and truffle aioli.
Lobster Roll 

I'm a total glutton when eating here, but it was delicious! It was even better with a satisfying hand craft beer!

We wanted to grab a bite to eat for lunch and didn't want to travel far so we stumbled upon this place.  I really wasn't expecting much from the food.  I mean a $20 bacon burger better be amazing but I really was skeptical.  But when it arrived I was pleasantly surprised.  The burger was massive!  And to be honest I couldn't finish it.  Wait... That was probably due to the fact that the nachos were ginormous!  I forgot to mention that. Definitely get the nachos!  It's huge and could feed a family of 5, and it was sooooo good!  Layers upon layers and layers of toppings.  The picture explains it all.  We also got the bbq platter which we could hardly break into cause of the massive nachos and burger.  Oh this was all shared between three people. 

The waitstaff was really friendly and was very attentive.  Probably a bit too attentive.  Maybe coming to check on is every 5 mins... Not sure if I like that.  Oh and the Bloody Mary isn't too bad either.  And their menu had the rules on how to play kings
Nice setup for watching sports. Fish tacos are delicious along with the Cuban Summer mixed drink. PBR tall boys come in a souvenir brown paper bag coozie. Fun place

Know ahead of time the food portions are relatively small, the prices high, and the menu selection isn't amazing, but they do have a couple of good selections. 4 stars because we will probably eat here again and while some stuff wasn't amazing, nothing was really bad.

the decorations and theme of the restaurant is casual and on the light side. Tv's everywhere of course and entertaining sayings on the walls.

Had the fried pickles appetizer which is an entire spear deep fried. Not crazy about it but apparently it's what all the cool restaurants are doing these days.

I had the shrimp and grits which wasn't terrible but not amazing either. I felt like I was eating out of a sombrero because the plate had a ridiculous rim, and the grits were more like mashed potatoes. The shrimp had good flavor and it also had a pretty tasty piece of sausage in there too. 

Also tried the brisket: I'll forgive them because it's not Texas, but it didn't blow my mind.

The 1842 burger on the other hand blew my mind, and upon tasting it after finishing my meal and deciding I was full, proceeded to eat half of my friends burger. Mushrooms were fantastic and some crack laced aoli I think.

The Mac and cheese is also fantastic. Great flavor with actual melted cheese instead of the packet crap and its dusted with a spice that I think is also laced with crack.

Finally, dessert...
The butterscotch custard is heaven in a little bowl with a solid layer of caramel and a little bit of whip cream and something crunchy. We also had some chocolate cake which has a river of caramel mousse next to it with caramel corn for crunch. 

Take home story, go for the burger, get dessert, return to your room and fall into a coma.

I LOVED this pub! 

We had lunch here during a conference in May, and honestly I am STILL raving to people about those nachos!

I only had water since it was mid conference day, but my friend had a drink and she said it was delish!

We sat at the bar, and the female bartender working was good also. She gave us a bit less attention then the guys on the opposit side of the bar from us, but thats basically to be expected. 

I will be back here for sure next time I'm at MGM. Dont dare get rid of those nachos!

This is the best pub I've been too to date. 24 beers on tap. Outstanding food and great customer service.  My wife and I had the pretzels and beer cheese for an appetizer.  We then ordered two orders of the brisket sliders. We both died and went to heaven. If I could fit More food in my belly I would. If I could give this place 6 stars I would. OUTSTANDING!!  Ask for Mark the bartender. Great, friendly and knowledgeable service. We will definitely come here every time we r in Vegas.

Really loved the food here, plus convenient for the room! We didnt feel like dealing with the strip or getting out, so we used yelp to pick a place inside the MGM to eat, glad we did. The reviews on the nachos are right, they are dang good! But way big, so share, even if its for your meal, you can still share! We also got the lobster corndogs. Have to say, wasnt impressed with those..should have stuck more to the BBQ menu or something, but they werent terrible. The waiter was super friendly, telling us other places we could check out, and the atmosphere was good. Wasnt overly loud and crazy, but still upbeat. Would definitely go back here on our next trip and would recommend it to anyone!

Newly opened and situated in the district area of MGM lies Pub 1842 courtesy of Michael Mina. With a large rectangle bar right smack dab in the  middle along with booth seating on each side as well as an open kitchen in the back, 1842 gives you that local bar vibe with a touch of sophistication.

Greeted as we sat down at the bar, the bartender was most hospitable. I had ask him to make me a drink whiskey based and he delivered with an old fashion made with jim beam that was aged for four months in a miniature oak barrel that was sitting at the bar. Delicious. They also have a decent selection of beers, wine and cocktails.

Food-wise, i went for the peanut butter crunch burger (i also asked them to put a fried egg on which they accommodated me on that request). It's one of those food where you know it's sooo bad for you but taste sooo good. My buddy opt'd for the bacon cheeseburger which was also a home run. The fries reminded me of fresh out the fryer Mcdonald's fries.

Solid food, good drinks and nice staff? A top 5 gastropub on my list.

Nice atmosphere.
Excellent Service.
I removed a star due to the food being mediocre. 
Lots of beer selections and excellent drink specials.  

Enjoy!
This place was really good if you are looking for a good burger . It's a little pricey but it's worth it. I loved the double smoke house something burger forgot the name .

My husband and I dropped into this place since we were staying at the signature hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. We both ordered the 1842 burger. It literally melts in your mouth. The fries were fresh and had barbeque seasoning (tasted like bbq chips, but better). Service was decent. Would definitely visit again.

Service here is really weird, but the food is fantastic. The NFL playoffs were on, so they told a lot of people that they couldn't seat them, except, when they seated our party of 8, there were empty tables everywhere. Even the bar had seating. Wasn't quite sure what they were doing, but plates are massive here. BLT's have two layers for the sandwich with loads of meat and cheese. Fries are abundant and cheap, and if you get their signature nacho plate, you get a ridiculous heaping stack of chips, beans, cheese, and peppers. It's enough to make you think you've fallen into nacho heaven, and it's not overly pricey for a Michael Mina place...inside the MGM. Food comes out pretty quickly, and waitstaff is pretty nice once you get in. Great place to watch a game, drink a brew, and eat some pub grub.

All I can say is Wow! My husband and have been here a week eating at 5 star restaurants and none of them have compared to this! We were walking to the mgm pool and decided to stop so we didn't have to eat food by the pool. "Food snobs"
The flavor in the food is definitely there! The best buffalo wings we have ever tasted and the turkey burger and kale salad are amazing!! 

Mike is a great server too.

Eat here you will not be disappointed.

OH EM GEE.... This place has literally changed my life!!

We had time to kill before the Justin Timberlake concert. Walked to the food court, but neither my husband or I was interested in what was there. I mean, it was the usual...McDonalds, Chinese, pizza, burgers and hotdogs. Since we had 2 hours until the concert, we decided to try this place out. Best decision ever!!

At first, it looked like there was a wait. Luckily, a bunch of people were just looking at the menu and asking the hostess questions, so we were actually seated right away in a booth. The first thing I noticed was that water was served in mason jars, which was cool because you don't see that very often. Our server was William, who was very friendly, knowledgeable with the menu and very attentive. The one item on the menu that caught my eye was the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger. Yes, you heard that right. The Peanut Butter Crunch Burger. As crazy and odd as it sounds, it seemed very interesting and I just had to try it. 

Just an FYI, all of their burgers are 1/2 pound. So come hungry, or agree to share! My husband was going to order The Champ, but after finding out that the burgers were were huge, we decided to share. They were able to cut the burger in half and add an equal amount of fries in each basket for $1.50 more. We also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese. The burger was HEAVEN in my mouth!! I don't even know who Michael Mina is, but he is a fricken GENIUS!! The meat was cooked perfectly, it was hot and juicy. The peanut butter and bacon jam made the burger awesome! It was sweet and salty, which I normally would not want to taste in a burger. But, it was THE BEST BURGER EVER!! Honestly, I'm not really a burger person. There are good burgers, there are bad burgers, and at the end of the day, it's just a damn burger. But, this is the one that I will remember forever! My favorite for sure!! Soooo delicious, my husband loved it as well. Ok, I won't say anymore. Just go and try it! The Mac and cheese was pretty good too, not too salty or rich, and they cut the broccoli into small pieces. 

I can't wait to come back here! I also don't know if I can order something different next time. Again Michael Mina, you are a genius and thank you so much for your heavenly burger!!! And...if you ever feel like opening another location, can you do one away from the strip? Say Westside or Summerlin area? That would be great. :P

I went here last night before seeing Kà.  I had read some of the Yelp reviews of good friends and I knew exactly what I would order.  When the time came, I changed my mind and I ordered two things differently than I had planned.

I started with the lobster corn dogs which were accompanied by a container of crème fraîche flavored with whole grained mustard.  I have never had a regular corn dog--ever-- so this was a treat in more ways than one.  The lobster was very flavorful, the coating was a nice soft texture, and the mustard sauce made the combination a winner.

Next I got the peanut butter crunch burger.  It's a large burger, I'm figuring 8 ounces before cooking, served on a bed of fries.  The burger is topped with peanut butter and some bacon jam.  There are also a number of ribbed potato chips on top and it gives a nice crunchiness to the burger.  I asked for it rare and that's the way I got it.  The fries were crispy but there were way too many.

For dessert, I tried one of their cakes 'n shakes pairings.  I got the roasted peach and almond buckle that comes with a salted caramel shake and a small container of bourbon toffee to pour into the buckle like you would flavoring into a soufflé.  It was very good but the salted caramel shake which was very thick needed more salt.  I didn't taste any salt at all.

Service was excellent for most part.  It took quite awhile to get my check because it seemed like everyone was getting ready to leave at the same time.  Until then everything was good.  I was brought a new iced tea before my other one was finished, there was a clean fork brought between the corn dogs and the burger--in short--the kind of attention you get from higher end restaurants and not generally associated with a gastropubs.  

I really liked my time at the pub and I found it a great place for a person eating alone.  There was a TV near where I was sitting.  I enjoyed watching the Washington Nationals game.  The place is loud and it would be hard to have a decent conversation but people were.

Best nachos ever love the green onions sprinkled on top for added color! We came during happy hour and got a deal on our beers. Totally cool sports bar pub in the MGM. The burgers are so amazing. I got the blue cheese with mushrooms. I love the bun on this burger. I like the feel of cozy booths and just had a great time with my husband. I ate way to much because every bite was so delicious. I have to be healthy for a week now! It was our last meal in Vegas and it was the perfect choice.

We just stopped here on a whim for lunch and let me tell you, if you like burgers this is a great choice. I indulged in the 1842 Burger with pepper jack cheese and it was bar none one if the best burgers I have eaten. A beautiful friendly waitress was on top if all of our dining needs and my beer was never empty. If your there definitely try it out, you won't be disappointed:-)

I visited the Pub 1842 on (2) occasions during my week long stay in Las Vegas, the first experience was marginally acceptable, gave it another chance which was an incremental improvement. On the third attempt, mostly due to lack of casual evening options currently available in the MGM Grand, I ended up walking out due to what I deem to be generally poor attentiveness by the "General Manager" and the staff under his charge. I have visited a number of Michael Mina's' restaurants' in various cities along the west coast and had always had an enjoyable experience, when you place a name like Michael Mina on the door of a pub you rightly expect a whole other level of pub. I can't say my experience with Pub 1842 in the MGM Grand met Mina level expectations. I will start with the good:

- location good relative to the MGM hotel layout
- nice floorplan and decor 
- very good beer selection on tap and bottled
- good wine and liquor selection
- good menu 
- taste of food was good
- being a pub, there is a potential to fill what I would opine as a void in venue options absent in most other casino/hotels in Las Vegas, the only other pub I know of is the Ri Ra in between the Mandalay and Luxor, at least as it pertains to casino/hotel interiors.

The average & inconsistent:
- Greeters/hosts at front door very average to disappointing, don't look you in the eye when they speak to you, distracted & no smile. I generally felt that they didn't understand that there is a higher level expectation when employed by an establishment bearing Michael Mina's name, hence his reputation. I have to say I have received a higher quality greeting at Hooters establishments.

- Servers in restaurant, while generally friendly, were very inconsistent and NOT knowledgeable about the menu or dishes they are charged with serving to the customers. 

- Servers not knowledgeable about the establishment, there is a unique feature in the Pub 1842 in that there are a few taps with seating around them. We inquired of the staff on our first visit how that worked and they replied an uninspiring "I don't know" however, a fellow customer overheard us and was kind enough to explain.

- Bartenders and barbacks inconsistently attentive in regards to consistently checking in with customers, was challenging to get their attention, even while not busy, barbacks were of no help to customers where they could have assisted the customers via getting the bartenders attention. Took a long time to get the check and equally as long to process the payment.

The Bad: (In my opinion)

- General Manager, in my opinion, doesn't get it. As previously mentioned I walked out on my third visit over some confusion regarding seating directions from the host staff and generally rude attitude of one of the servers. I attempted to address a gentleman that stated he was the GM, yet, he really didn't introduce himself. I explained the situation and he seemed genuinely disinterested in assisting us, so, we decided to go elsewhere. We ended up at Wolfgang Puck's establishment in the middle of the casino and had a delightful experience, good food and service, despite the fact that my colleagues and myself being very underdressed for the venue, relative to the other patrons.

All that being said, given the nice decor and unique self serve tap feature available there seem like there is some potential for Pub 1842, perhaps a rearrangement of the staff might bring out that potential. In summary, currently, given the gourmet prices I would not return to the Pub 1842's less than gourmet service and would not recommend it until some service improvements are put in place.
The sliders with kale were delicious! Also had the lobster grilled cheese and deep fried pickles, also very tasty. Bartender was friendly and the atmosphere was laid back.

This would have easily been 4 stars, maybe 5 if it wasn't for the waitress (Lindsey M). She was great for the first 10 minutes or so until a group of guys came in from a conference and then we didn't see her until she brought the bill. All we saw of her after that was her flirting, talking to the guys and bringing them everything quickly when they ordered. Food runners brought us everything after that. We never got asked if we wanted another drink, we were never checked on when the apps or main meal came. After we were done and just sitting, waiting, with empty water and drink glasses we were asked if we wanted dessert. At this point we just wanted to leave, we got the check and went somewhere else to have a couple more drinks. The drinks were great, frickles and deviled eggs were awesome (wish the frickles were chips, they were a little difficult to eat as the batter comes off when you slice them), the PB crunch burger was very good and lastly, the double dog dare was good BUT, tough to eat. It REALLY needs a top bun so you can pick it up. An open faced hot dog wrapped in bacon is a PITA to eat with a knife and fork. The taste was perfect though

I was not impressed and I wanted to eat here so bad. The turkey burger was not very good at all.  I also had the nachos which were good, and huge order, but it was sour creamed to death.  I probably won't go back here in the future.

Had dinner here the other night it was a perfect combination of upscale casual food and Michael Mina quality. The Carolina drumsticks were large flavorful and surprisingly sweet with a fresh made blue cheese dressing that is just a perfect combo. The burger which was the the all American bash burger or something to that extent juicy, tender, and packed with so many different angles of flavor. The fries might have been a bit over seasoned but still tasted great. Cocktail wise I had the green monster which was quite refreshing. Then Davey I believe was his name was charming and a great chat for a bartender. Wonderful service.

Pretty cool pub inside the MGM... it's located in the Restaurant Row on your way to the Garden Arena.

They are serving up tasty goodies like homemade fried pickles, pork nachos and homemade pretzels.... this is just a short list... of the appetizers.  These were all the things I saw and wanted to try.  The Nachos were HUGE and looked "oh-so-yummy".  The table next to us was digging into these... and seemed to be enjoying them immensely.

But I was "being good".... sort of.  I restrained from filling up on these appetizers. We opted to share the ceviche... and then I shared a burger and salad with my mom.

Ceviche was good... not the best I ever had but definitely solid!  Lots of shrimps and scallops so PLUS there. I'm just picky... so keep that into account.    

We had the 1842 burger (medium) and the chopped Chinese salad.  The Burger was SUCCULENT... JUICY.... MELT-IN-YOUR-MOUTH.... Yumminess!  Might be my new favorite burger.  I'm a big Bachi Burger fan... and this is right there...lots of flavor, savoriness and excellently prepared.  And then there's the Bun... Yes, the Bun is newsworthy... it was light and airy and soft.  It wasn't hard or dense.  I think it's definitely homemade cuz it just melted in your mouth along with the burger.  (Note... I was totally unimpressed with the store pickles they served with the burger.... it was limp and soggy.  I was expecting something more hand-crafted-like.)  The fries were ok.... nothing to get excited about.  But the Burger... The Burger is the Star!

The Salad was quite large!  Definitely Entrée sized.  Even for the 2 of us we didn't finish all of it.  The dressing was Fabulous... light, not overpowering and just a hint of ginger.  I'd definitely order it again.  I mean... if I was "being good".  But I'd probably end up having the burger.  LOL!

The Atmo .... Dark like a pub... but not murky... lots of TVs everywhere.  It being March... there was Round-Ball on the tubes everywhere so we got a good variety of games to watch all at once.  It seemed like everywhere had a pretty good view of at least 2 TVs.

The Service.... The waitstaff / server / water guy... All On Point!  They were on top of it.  

I definitely recommend making reservations if you plan on getting there after 5pm on a weekend.  We were there on a Saturday night at 5:15pm and we had about a 25 minute wait.

It was a little bittersweet knowing that SEABLUE had closed down and Michael Mina re-imagined the space into Pub 1842, a more casual gastropub.  The bright side is that because the food is more casual fare, it makes it more easy for everyone to come in for some upscale and creative bar food without spending too much.  The best part was that almost everything on the menu came with Michael Mina's famous Duck Fat Fries.

I didn't plan on having a big meal this visit, but instead for an afternoon snack.  And the perfect entree for that was the Double Dog Dare.

The Double Dog Dare. --  http://bit.ly/1h4zPzJ
Bacon-wrapped "double barrel" wagyu dogs, guacamole, pico de gallo, chicharones 
This is definitely a knife and fork type of dog because there really isn't any way to eat this with your hands.  And although it may seem too much on paper, it all works together, especially with the guacamole, bacon, and crispy chicharones!!  And yes, it came with the Duck Fat Fries!  Okay, so it's a little too much for an afternoon snack, but it was so good!

I also thought it was really cool that they sat me at a table right across from the kitchen so I got to see firsthand how my Double Dog Dare was made (http://bit.ly/1faB6nw).

So despite me coming in just for a 'small' meal, my experience at Pub 1842 was pretty enjoyable.  They definitely did a complete 180 turn with the space compared to when it was SEABLUE, but it really is all for the better.  I really want to come back to try more of theie creative bar food, especially the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger!!

I stopped in here for a dinner with some girlfriends during a celebratory weekend in Vegas.  I had never heard of Michael Mina, but one of my friends was a big fan and picked out this place for our first night in town.

The place is located inside the MGM Grand.  We wandered around for a little bit, but finally found the place.  The place looked pretty packed, but we were quickly seated since we had a reservation.  We were in a big booth that seated 6.  I noticed that the hightop tables next to us had self-serve taps on the table, if beer happens to be your thing.  Beer is not quite my thing so I ordered a drink called Fog City.  It's a rum based punch that packs a pretty nice punch.  It's tasty too.

We started off with an order of pretzels and frickles.  The pretzels are bigger pretzel sticks served with a beer cheese sauce that has a poached egg in the middle.  Several of the girls picked around the egg, but I went all in and broke it so I could enjoy it.  I think it made the beer cheese sauce better.  The fickles is their version of fried pickles.  Instead of being pickle slices like chips, they are fried pickle spears.  They didn't really look that appetizing, but they were actually pretty good.  The special sauce that they serve on the side is what makes it so good.  Make sure you get extra of that stuff.

I ended up ordering the 1842 burger for my entree.  I subbed out a turkey patty for the beef patty.  The 1842 burger is topped with caramelized onions, mushrooms, and truffle aioli.  The toppings really made the turkey burger good.  The turkey patty was a bit on the dry side, but acceptable.  I'm sure it would have been even better with the beef patty.  The burger came with a side of fries.  They are your usual fries.

Overall, the food was pretty good and the company even better.  I will say that service was on the slow side.  Our server was pretty busy and it took a while to get water and beverage refills.  Paying was a bit of a pain because we had to break out the bill ourselves.  She said that she could do it for us, but that it would take her a really long time.  We had already been there for quite a bit so we went ahead and used our handy dandy TAB app on our phone to make splitting the check a breeze.

Dear Micheal Mina,

This is a awesome pub dishing out delicious eats.  PUB is your typical pub with a plethora of popular bar eats with a fancy twist.  While staying at the MGM Grand my friends and I were in search of legit grub. My Yelp search led me here.

The menu boasted heavily about the craft burgers, nachos and fried pickles. They had me at Nachos. So my girl group headed in and we were seated right away. We were seated next to a wedding party closest to the kitchen. Seating was comfortable.  The ambiance is a modern pub. A bar closest to the door with flat screens and the rest is booths and tables.

We walked in with our drinks from Fat Tuesday and started off with the Nachos. The Nachos. Man...those nachos.  Life changing. A XXL sized tray of Crisp, warm tortilla chips topped with cilantro,  black beans, tomato,  cheddar, sour cream. This is a prime choice when with a large party. We ordered 2 Salmon burgers, side salad A bacon cheeseburger and of course I ordered the vegetarian Falafel burger with a side salad. These burgers were....some heavy weights. HUMONGOUS portions. 

The Falafel burger was the best I ever had like Drake. Crisp. Perfection. Chick peas drizzled with some banging Tahini. I ate half and saved the rest for my late night snack. My girls didn't care for the Salmon burgers.  They felt they were dry and I was happy I stuck to my falafel. 

Mr. Mina, I'll be back to sample the craft cocktails.

OK, so after a UFC fight we decided to have a little after fight grub here.  The food was good but I was most excited to try the Moscow Mule (of course).  This drink brought my rating down.  Only because it is served in an original Moscow Mule cup, with Fever tree so there are some high expectations.  Missed the mark.  I ordered a second one...missed the mark.  I wasn't too sure why but there was a ton of crushed ice.  I asked the server to have the bartender either half or just hold the ice altogether.  She did and the third drink was what I know as a Moscow Mule. So ice was the culprit.  Wayyyyyyy toooo much ice.  Anyway, back to the food.  Delicious.  We ordered many appetizers and I got the chili and it was good-good.  So I'm torn.  For now I'll do three stars and next time have them hold the ice.
