My husband and I split the pretzels and cheese, bacon cheeseburger with BBQ fries, and a vanilla milkshake. All were great! The cheese and pretzels came with a lot more cheese than pretzels so we saved the leftover cheese and dipped our fries in it as well. :) the burger was on point and helped us kick a Vegas hangover. Definitely recommend this place!!

One of our favorite places to go. We love the duck spring rolls and the drumsticks. Only downside at least for my bf is the only happy hour beer is PBR. He says he's not a fan yet orders it anyways lol. I've yet to have anything I don't like here. Can't wait to be in town in two weeks.

This is one if my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas! Everything is amazing from the atmosphere to the employees and of course the food! Jaime, the server is very friendly and knowledgable about the menu. Every question I had was quickly answered and every suggestion he made turned out very good. I had the nachos (suggested by Jaime) to start off with which were literally to die for. I never knew nachos could taste so good, but all the ingredients just mix so well.  For my main course I had the heritage burger (I don't like turkey so the generously substituted the turkey for ground beef) the guacamole burger here was the best burger I've ever had hands down. It's the best burger for me Because the sauce they put in the burger and the guac mix so well... And I have a soft spot for guac and spicy food and that burger had the perfect amount of both. I finished with the 3 milkshakes as my dessert also suggested by Jaime, although I am not really a milkshake kind of person they really amazed me they were so delicious! I killed half of my nachos and ate my whole burger so by the time I got to my milkshakes I was so stuffed after a few sips of each milkshake I finally had enough, let's just say it was very difficult walking back to the car. Oh.... And they probably have the best filtered water in town.

A little pricey but do take into consideration you are eating on the Vegas strip.

The service is good.  Food is great.  Beer and drinks are amazing.  Came here with the bf before a night out and I got the lobster corndogs and the kale cesar salad.  I would get both again!  Bf had a sandwich and friends but I was too concerned with my own food to both on how his was haha.

Sure, this celebrity chef joint located along restaurant row in the MGM Grand district area is actually a nifty sports bar to catch a game or grab a comfort food bite to help get over a hangover, but it's also a decent spot to have a good cocktail and burger.

Friendly service in a cozy atmosphere with solid eats. Very laid back and unpretentious. Actually a fun spot. Plenty of flat screens to watch a game. A terrific selection of brews with over 40 selections of beer on tap and in bottles/cans, including ales, stouts and lagers - oh my!

When I was staying at MGM Grand during a biz trip not too long ago I had a night open for dinner so I dropped in here to try it out. Sat at the bar where the bartenders were attentive and took fine care of me.

Had to go with one of their specialties. The PUB 1842 Burger - caramelized onions, mushrooms and truffle aioli. It was $17 which seems a bit pricey but it was really tasty. Cooked just right and juicy. The crispy bbq fries that came with it were a good side. We all know that dining in casinos is always on the pricier end, so it was kind of expected, but at least this was worth it as the portion was pretty large.

Oh, and I washed this down with a properly made sazerac. Why not? They offer some innovative cocktails and adult milkshakes, but I went with a classic.

It is Vegas after all and if I want a sazerac with my burger then so be it!
Service was great and food was amazing! Portions are huge enough for two share especially if you get appetizers. Great drink specials for sports nights. Would definately come back.

One of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas. The burgers are amazing, the brisket melts in your mouth and the seasoned fries are a must. If you go for dinner I recommend sitting at the bar...Gretyl, Liz and Joe are the best.

I usually will only write good reviews but the experience was so bad here that I needed to do something about it. So here's my experience:

1. The food was hit and miss. My fiancé got the Double Dog Dare which was decent. I got the 1842 Burger. I asked for it medium and instead got it burnt. I could literally taste the burnt outside with every bite. Quite possibly the worst burger I've ever had. I couldn't ask for a new one because I never saw my server. Which leads to my next point. 

2. The service was awful. We saw our waiter one time to order and that was it. No drink refills no anything. After having had finished, I waited 15 minutes before finally asking a busser to get our check for us. 

3. Lastly I had a 25 dollar gift certificate from Restaurant.com. I tried to use it on my phone and they wouldn't allow it. Like Groupon there is a button to press to validate it specifically for your phone but they refused. I asked the manager why and he said they just needed a printed page with the same exact code they would put in. Why other restaurants all honor the mobile coupon and they don't, I don't know. But I definitely know this was the worst experience I've ever had and the worst $55 dollars ever spent. Please spare yourselves from this place.

This is one of the best places I've eaten. There was a long line at most of the other nearby restaurants, but we were able to walk right in here. My husband tried the PB&J burger, which he loved (and he's not a huge fan of cheese or peanut butter). He also tried the around the world beer sampler, which was a great deal and had some good variety.

Being gluten free, I was surprised at the number of choices I had! I decided on a wedge salad and a baked potato. The salad - amazing! The bacon was like ham - thick and juicy (but tasted like bacon!). And then the potato - best potato of my life. The skin was crisp and salty. Honestly, the skin was better than the inside, which never happens. Between those two things, I had MORE than enough food, and was totally stuffed. I shared both the salad and potato with my husband, and still had leftovers. We'll be back for sure on our next trip.

Arguably the best hamburger I've ever eaten.  Bacon cheeseburger was cooked to absolute perfection.  To top it off, the appetizer of fried pickles hit the spot with the Moscow mules.  Will return, maybe even tomorrow.

I like Pub 1842. There's good food, good service- can't complain! 

I remember going to their grand opening 2 years ago or so, I was excited to check out Michael Mina's new pub. They brought around appetizers so we were able to try a few of their menu items. The duck spring rolls and lobster corn dogs were delicious. Not your typical pub food!

Since then, I've been back to Pub 1842 quite a few times. I'm pretty simple when it comes to pub/bar food. For a starter, I would recommend their pretzel. Comes out freshly baked with a beer cheese dipping sauce. There's a poached egg and bacon bits in the cheese... Amazing! 

If you want something light, I would absolutely recommend the Avocado Kale Caesar Salad. Kale has a unique bitter taste which some people love/hate. I personally am a fan and think it's a great contrast to the Caesar dressing. You can add protein it if you like (I've added the garlic shrimp and the salmon before, I prefer the shrimp). 

If you want to go for a burger, I've tried the 1842 burger and it's a solid choice if you like truffle and mushrooms. I've tried the Double Smoked Bacon burger which is meaty and flavorful, with large pieces of bacon and smoked gouda on top of the patty. They have some unique burgers too, a Peanut Butter Crunch burger and a Korean BBQ Salmon burger. I haven't tried either of those yet but I'm sure I will at some point! 

Good pub-style food and the service hasn't disappointed yet. I'll be back again!

This place is a really nice new addition to the MGM food corridor with some great comfort food type menu items done with some flair and executed very well.  We had a champ burger, fish and chips, brisket Benedict, and a kids chicken basket.  Everything was tasty especially the brisket Benedict and their fries are nicely seasoned with herbs and cooked just right.  I would definitely revisit to try many of the other tempting menu items like the lobster corn dogs.  Don't expect anything too fancy here but it's all well prepared and a comparable price to other places like it considering the location.  $16 for brisket Benedict, $19 for the champ burger with fries, $26 for fish and chips, and $14 for a salad isn't cheap but that's probably due to location.

This place was very great! Great food, friendly staff, and loved the ambiance. Ordered the Nachos as an appetizer and it was delicious!!! There was 5 of us, and we still couldn't finish it. Then for my entree I got  the 1842 burger and added bleu cheese crumbles. It was ALOT! Delicious, but soooo much. Make sure you come here HUNGRY!! You won't be disappointed.

The fried pickles and actually the pickle served with the burgers were awesome so I was really expecting more from the burgers.  My hubby had the bacon cheeseburger and I had the peanut butter one.  The bacon burger had a very strong charcoal/grill taste and mine was just okay, with all the flavors just sort of blending together.  The atmosphere was great however.

Came here on a Sunday evening and sat at the bar. The two bartenders were very friendly but overwhelmed by the volume of drinks being ordered in the restaurant. I ordered the crab cake appetizer and the 8 oz. filet mignon. The crab cake was EXCELLENT and the only good highlight of this visit. However, the kitchen screwed up the cooking of the filet. I ordered medium and it came out rare. Of course, once they try to re-cook it to the proper temperature, it is never the same, and this was no exception. I usually don't take the risk of ordering a $40+ steak in a "pub" vs. a true steakhouse, but I didn't listen to myself this time. The bartender apologized, but it wasn't his fault. The kitchen gave me an extra order of fries, but I don't know what I was supposed to do with a combined pile of fries the size of my head.

Three people, 6 beers, three burgers, two salads = $225 with tip. Yup...we're in Las Vegas alright. The food was good, not great. The service was fine. I'm losing my enthusiasm for Vegas dining. Its all so overpriced that its now just plain sad.

The service was excellent and the drinks were awesome.  The burgers were cool but it was missing that  umph considering I have been juicing  weeks  before I had a burger.  Still a place to come to  check out.

Michael Mina's Pub 1842 is in the heart of MGM Grand district -- a long hallway with an odd combination of high end restaurants, shops, and a food court. It took over for Sea Blue, also owned by Mina. The place was loud. Like night club loud. And, it attracts the pool/day club crowd so you'll see plenty of drunk dudes in tank tops.

The menu is full of stuff you'll be familiar with. But there's a twist with most, if not all, dishes. An ingredient or two that has been added to those comfort dishes to make them new and exciting. Like peanut butter on a burger or popcorn on a lobster roll. I couldn't pass up the peanut butter crunch burger ($14). The combo was so odd that I had to try it. And, you know what? It works. The peanut butter lightly coats the underside of the top bun. There isn't a lot of it, but there's no mistaking the taste when you take a bite. In combination with the crunchy, salty chips and a perfectly well seasoned beef patty with a crispy char coating, it makes for a great array of flavors and textures that are unexpected yet pleasing. It may not be the best burger I've had, but it was certainly memorable.

The other food was decent, but a step down from the burger. The jumbo lump crab cake ($19) was tasty, especially with the garlic basil dressing. The avocado kale caesar ($14) was an unnecessarily large portion that tasted good after the first few bites but was so rich that we left the rest of it untouched. They took what should have been a healthy and light dish and fattened it up needlessly. We ordered a side of chicken ($14) that my kid had for his dinner. 

The one side dish we got was the mac and cheese ($9). It was as creamy, smokey, and cheesy as we had hoped but what ruined it for us was the broccoli. I'm not a fan of broccoli in mac and cheese and if they had bothered to list that ingredient on the menu I probably would not have ordered it. 

We didn't stick around for dessert, although those options all sounded delicious. Service was spotty, as can be expected from a newly opened restaurant.

They've got a few tables with their own beer taps. Customers can swipe their credit card and pour their own beer. Might be some of the best tables around for drinking and people watching.

The menu has plenty of attractive sounding dishes and I'm sure I'll be back eventually, but I know which dishes i won't be ordering again.

The bacon double cheeseburger was outstanding. The fries were good, however I'm just not a fan of shoestring fries I wish they were Steak fires instead. I must say they give you plenty. Try the 1842 pretzels, the poached egg in the melted cheese is a definite new twist.

REALLY good food. Anything you get here will be a well crafted dish, thoughtfully prepared, carefully delivered. 

The infamous peanut butter and bacon jelly burger is worth trying, but the peanut butter part gets a little intense and exhausting after a few bites. I loved the breakfast burrito and fried pickles--maybe opt for those and get your friend to order the burger. 

All said, I walked away being truly impressed with the quality of the whole experience, from the fun drinking "isms" that greeted me on the chalkboard over the bar to the very earnest service from food runners and bussers alike, and all of the deliciousness in between.

The lobster corn dogs were horrible and pricey.  I would have rather eaten a normal corn dog.  The crunchy peanut butter burger was intense but almost impossible to eat.  I shared a burger and we managed to get through 1/2 of it between the two of us.  We stayed a while and had a couple cocktails.  One was super sweet and they didn't have a problem remaking it.  Overall had fun there but don't think  the food is very good.

We got peanutbutter burger.  My husband loved it!!!!  How can you go wrong?   I got the bourbon burger yummy and messy!  Perfect after a long night in vegas!   Got side garden salad.  Gross.   Huge pieces of lettuce and like 3 shaved vegetables.   Maybe try mini kale ceasar or mink wedge.

I ate lunch here yesterday with a large group of people.  The waiters were great.  I wasn't a huge fan of the food as I'm not a great fan of BBQ- like food.  The fries were barbecue flavor.  They were ok but I wasn't a fan.  The grand burger was ok and I'm sure other people liked their meal but I was not impressed.  I would probably not return.
Such rude staff! Not one person between bartender, waitress, manager was helpful. Small selection of food! No were to stand or sit. Drinks were ok!

Service was great. I ordered the double bacon burger . I thought it was ok. The meat was good. Bun was great but the bacon was sub par. It was not 2x smoked and it was paper thin - like stuff your mom buys at the grocery store. Major let down and this gets 3 stars.  The special sauce was great but overall not close to being a $18 burger. It's vegas, oh well. 

The shakes were great as well
Not a bad little sports bar.  We had a really good cider beer and a delicious pretzel with cheese appetizer.  I do feel it is extremely overpriced however and probably won't be back.

my boss told me about this place. MAN! probably the best burger i have ever had , PEANUT BUTTER CRUNCH BURGER!!!! plus my girlfriend had the 1842 burger. we were in burger heaven. oh!? we also had the duck spring rolls too.. yummy!!!!
this will be one of my spots when i come to sincity....

This is literally my 7th review. Im not a food blogger. 

Do yourself a favor. Get the Peanut Butter Crunch burger - period. It will be weird, and you will have to get about 25-35% of the way through before you figure out if you like it or not, but believe me...you will love it. I've literally came to this place three times to JUST eat that burger and it beats any and all places (Nations in SF Bay, In & Out, Shake Shack, etc.). 

It's weird. But it's effing delicious. Unless you're allergic to something, don't even bother ordering anything else.

*TIP* Get some Sriracha sauce (no, Im not a big fan of it usually). Just put a tiny tab before each bite and with the fries. You're welcome and Im forever sorry for ruining any and every burger before and after this.
you gotta stay and eat here! best bugers and great service too  you must stop by  and try their hummus , it comes with crisp veggies a vinegar light taste to it

Michael Mina has done it again. Located in the space that formerly housed Seablue at MGM Grand, they have retained the lobster corn dogs on the menu. Yay!  The wait staff are very accommodating,  great attitudes. The ribs are fork tender and their burger selection includes salmon and turkey.

The beer selection is weak but o m g the nachos are seriously to die for.  Every bite is perfect and it comes with a lot.  I ended up taking the leftovers to go even though I knew the chips would be all soft and limp.  The next morning just woke up and went straight for them without even heating it up.  Flavor was still delicious cold. Also got the champ burger which was also good but the bun got a little soggy so was a little difficult to hold.  Will for sure be back for those nachos.

The brisket was so moist and tender, you did not need teeth to eat it. The jalepano cornbread is addictive. It has a slight sweet edge, perfect blend of flavors. The shrimp sausage and grits is a new spin on a southern favorite. It is real good. The lobster rolls with dipping sauce was very flavorful. They are hushpuppies with lobster in them and the sauce is tasty. I did not personally like the beans. They were well seasoned however, but i just did not like them. I recommend this pub and i definitely would go back.

#GoooodVibesss

Twas a tyical Vegas morning, hung over & hangry. We arrived just as they were opening & were slightly skeptical of the menu which seemed to mainly comprise of burgers. But after being seated we found other options. I had the kale ceasar salad with salmon, it was deeelish! Probably one of the most satisfying kale salads I've ever had. Also had the fried pickles, I hiiiighly recommend these as an appetizer. Spicy batter full of flavor & the pickles were plump & juicy. 

The wait staff was verry attentive, we were assisted by multiple waiters without having to ask. Our waitress was super kind, very informative, & you could tell they're trained to make their guests have a good experience. Would def go back if there weren't a million other places to try in Vegas!

The challenge - to find your way through the maze of the MGM to find Michael Mina Pub 1842

The reward - delicious food and drinks

After finally finding our destination of the pub we took a seat and began to ponder the menu.  Everything in Vegas is so expensive and Michael Mina is no exception.  My friend and I decided to split the large featured burger, I think it was called the Champ or some such.  Of course they charge for split entrees.  I am not a huge burger eater and neither is my friend but both of us loved this one.  We both agreed that it was on our lists of top burgers ever eaten.  The fries were also great, seasoned with bbq seasoning and they gave us a huge portion.  The drinks were also good - both cocktails and beer.  I am always happy when a bar gives you plenty of choices for beer and has local options to pick from.  The service was also very good.

We sat at the bar which had about four TVs. But they run the TVs a little strange and had hockey in half of the bar and basketball more in the restaurant.  We wanted to watch basketball so we had to squint a little.

The food was spot on. Also they have a very nice beer selection. It is a little pricey but the service and food were exceptional.

We shared two orders of chicken wings which are really chicken drumsticks.  They were really good and come with a blue cheese dressing.

I had a chop salad, which is really a half a head of iceberg lettuce with quarter inch thick pieces of bacon.  They chilled the head of lettuce so it is very crunchy and fresh and cold.  At $14 I was a little skeptical, but after eating it it was very tasty with quality bacon.

If you like tasteless mushroom appetizer, cold and tasteless fish tacos then this is the place for you to go.
both our appetizer and fish taco had no flavor and salt.  I complained about the tortilla being cold but our bartender assured me that they were made fresh and they got cold while waiting to be served....  
she offered to take it back or bring it to the chef's attention but we had waited long enough to get the food so we didn't want to wait anymore.

Excellent customer service here! 

Hubby LOvED Boulveardier -  it was too bitter for me, but he savored 2!  Clearly, it was a hit, and that block of square ice is always appreciated as it doesn't water drinks down like regular ice cubes. 

The salad $13 with grilled salmon $11 add on was a great entree!  Very generous portion for two of us.  The salmon was very fresh and beautifully cooked (we requested medium well) and the $9 sweet potatoes was really yummy (though a bit pricey for the smaller than expected size.)

We actually returned the next day for a half order of nachos and another Boulvardier.

I've only been here once, and it was a rather awkward experience.

Whenever I go to Vegas, the friends that I prefer to hang out with will live and die by MGM.  We went here looking for an okay spot for dinner, and it was a really disappointing experience.

At first, the service seemed good.  Our hostess was very welcoming as she led us to our booth, and I'll tell you -- in public, me and the guys are quite cool to be around.  But we never saw our server again.

I ordered a "Homemade Fireball" because it's a favorite of us back home, but it was horrible.  We had no chase either.  Disgusting.

I ordered a rack of ribs, which is usually conservative choice because you can't really grill those wrong, so it was good.  My friend had some nachos to start and those were great, but he didn't enjoy his entree--I think it was tuna.  My other friend didn't enjoy his prime rib either.

We don't usually box stuff, but that's what we ended up doing.

I see myself coming back for beer... but it's Vegas, I'm rarely ever here to have a beer.  But since I'm getting older, I'll probably hit this spot up on a casual Vegas night.
Absolutely go back here. Had dinner right before the AC/DC concert in January 2016, place was packed but still had good service. Food was good and the beer comes in boots....which I had many of.

Ate hear twice both takeout and both times ordered the same thing with different sides.

I have only eaten the Peanut Butter Crunch Burger with the first time being way over cooked and the second time super salty. I can see the concept behind this and if done right can be an excellent burger but sadly both times I tried they were ok at best.

I've ordered the Lobster Corn Dogs which sounds good but wasn't a fan of and the Homemade Frickles which were good.

Down to try PUB 1842 one more time and while the concept and idea sounds good the execution could be a lot better.

Terrible.  The server left in the middle of our table ordering.  Half of us have food.  You'll get better service at McDonald's.  I'd give better service if I was working for free.   If you spend money here you are an @$$hole.

Easy review. This place is legit. Service was good. Burgers were some of the best Ive had. Prices are high but you're at a Vegas resort restaurant. If they were local Id bump them down to 4 stars for exaggerated pricing but they aren't and it was awesome. Definitely go.

Went here twice and last night would be a 3 stars over 2 but service was horrible today . Last night stopped by for a drink before dinner and met a great bartender can't remember his name but he was great. We decided we would try to them for lunch. Came in and asked for a table we were sat in an empty section and told because we wanted lunch we needed to wait  15 min for that to start. No problem but from there seems like we were forgotten about many times after placing our order. The food was good got the ribs but the kale slaw and beans weren't my fave. I just feel if I am paying a lot of money for food the service needs to be up to par and it wasn't.  Too bad the good bartender from the night before wasn't there.

Michael Mina Pub 1842 is located in the MGM.

I had lunch here with my sister and our mom.  We ordered the frickles (fried pickles). Me and my sister each ordered their "1842 burger" while our mom had the "classic Italian sausage." The frickles were huge, 4 large, whole, deep fried pickles. Between the 3 of us we only finished off 2. I wouldn't order it again. When our orders came out it was clear that me and my sis should've shared the burger. They were HUGE. Our mom's order was also large. We all liked what we ordered....comfort food with a gastropub twist. 

It's a great addition to MGM's dining options. Pub 1842 offers generous portions of comfort food at reasonable prices. It fits in between MGM's cheaper food court eateries and its upscale restaurants.

Had two dinners here!! The food was amazing!! First I had two appetizers one was the calamari it was perfectly cooked and the second was bbq leg drum-sticks!! These were the best I ever had.  The crunch on the outer skin was perfection!! The juicy tender leg meat was fabulous!! The first night I had the bacon burger, it was incredible and huge!! I tried but couldn't finish it after the appetizers.  The second was a salmon burger and it was also on point!! Great place to eat!!

Two visits.  Both underwhelming for food.  Service however was great on both occasions.  

Elvis would be proud of the peanut butter burger which I almost got.  Should have, since it sounded pretty unique since other items I did get were not where I was hoping they would be.

BBQ sampler was tried on round one.  Now granted, BBQ is a very special thing and if you love it you can be fussy.  So when a "certified celebrity chef" (whatever the "f" that means) claims great Q,  it better be up in the ranking.  So , served on the now to common crappy tin tray, we had a decent brisket.  Marbled with enough fat to make it very tender.  Not much of a smoke flavor and the "rub" was not as flavorful as it should have been. Still solid.  The pulled pork was to salty but tender and no real crust which it should have.  The ribs pulled cleanly off the bone and had a nice thick glaze on top.  They were pretty solid but all in all I have had much better Q.  Only one sauce on the smokey side didn't help.  Beans were very very salty but had a lot of meat in them.  Kale slaw I liked.  Jalepeno cornbread was stale and honey butter was warm and rancid.  Had a nasty taste.  $ 32 bucks for this "sampler" tray was to high.

Round two brought a friend.  Got the fried cauliflower with a hot and sour sauce.  Liked this a lot.  Lightly breaded and tender.  Sauce was the right amount of hot and sweet.  Tasty. Went for the veggie burger which was made with falafel. Haven't seen that before! Points for being different but if you don't nail a falafel you are in trouble.   Friend liked the idea but said it was to gooey with all the stuff they put on it. He ate half of it.   I had a sauteed mushroom onion burger.  Slightly overcooked so it was not juicy.  If cooked a nice medium it would have been good.   But the mushrooms and onions were so frickin salty I was drinking whatever I could get my hands on all night.  A good chef should not be salting anything like this. I ate most of it before I realized how bad it was.  ( I was really hungry!).  I regretted it all night.

Some nice beer selections at modest ( by vegas standards) pricing.  

So maybe I ordered the wrong things here. Other dishes sound good.  Prices are less than most of the other high end places in vegas but this is a kind of simple plain "pub" concept so for that you are still paying 17 bucks for a burger.  I'd rather go to one of the high end places, pay more and get better food. 

A little less conversation... a little more action baby...

Met a friend here Friday , it's just a pub right?  Don't think so. This is ultra hip.I will start with the beers.A well versed blonde girl, beyond cute, Gretal,will guide you through the many taps and let you sample along the way.Now to the menu.I had some poke, lobster corn dogs, and then Gretal mentioned the peanut butter crunch burger with bacon jam, I said it.Drop whatever your doing and go get one.Words simply cannot describe this experience. Sweet little Jennifer showed us the wheel with a variety of infused spirits that we had to do it.Thanks Jennifer!  We even got to say hello to the Chef, Eric, who invited us back for the shakes and cakes.That's going to happen....definitely. Great place, going back with my girl.

Had Teresa as our server. Worst service EVER!!! Not friendly at ALL! Food was over priced and felt like I could of have gone anywhere else to get a better burger with a whole heck of a lot of better service!

Came here to watch the Giants v.s Royals 2014 World Series game and loved our experience. Sat at one of the high top tables by the bar and had a great view of the game on the screen.

If you like sweet cocktails then def try the Nacho Libre which contains espolón blanco, ruby port, agave syrup, fresh lime and ginger beer. Yum!!

For grub, I went with the fried chicken and cornbread waffle. Portion size was crazy and I couldn't finish my plate but def worth trying if you are a fan of fried chicken.

Service was fast and the waitress was incredibly friendly, def go back there again. Thumbs up! :)

Interesting place and selection of food located within the MGM Grand. We were seated and greeted right away by out waitress. We ordered our drinks and were told some specialties. I forget what we ordered (sorry) but everything was really good. It wasn't the best place I've ever eaten in but it was OK. The bar is large and they have tables with beer taps in the center so groups can pour their own beer at their leisure. There were TVs all around. There were food runners aside from the waitresses and everyone was very accommodating.

You would think a "famous " chef would know how to cook a basic burger, especially one that carries the name of the Pub. 
Medium well means that the meat is cooked!
They said 90% of the menu can be gluten free,  but most of the ingredients needed to be eliminated to make it gluten free.
Over priced and bland. You'd get more flavor from an In/Out Burger. 
Highly disappointed.
Food was pretty solid, but the service was exceptional. Ask for "Skittle Tits" as your waitress. because shes fucking awesome. oh and shes asian

Great casual bar with AMAZING food. We checked in around 9:30pm and were starving...did some quick research and since we wanted Burgers, this was apparently the place to check out. 

The restaurant was pretty quiet which made us weary.... but we sat down anyways because we were just so damn hungry!! 

Michael the bartender greeted us and started up a conversation - great guy, really cool and knows his shit about Vegas!! We ordered 2 burgers, the 1842 and the famous one that won the burger contest (I forget what its called.) Now, its very rare I'd pay $19 for a burger but these (both) were certainly worth it! The 1842 is a hearty angus burger with grilled onions, mushrooms, and truffle oil. TRUFFLE OIL. The burgers come with either salad or fries on the side, and Michael suggested we get one of each and share, as they are pretty large in portion (which was true.) The fries have this "mystery" seasoning that's sweet and DELICIOUS. Its some combination of paprika, garlic/onion salt AND brown sugar. 

Definitely a place I'd come back to when craving a good ass burger. =)

Husband and I came here to have a nice meal in a non stuffy restaurant. The server we had was very helpful and suggested our meals and cocktails. I had the avocado kale salad and he had the salmon burger. To drink I had the "jungle juice" which was really good. We had a nice dinner and got to watch the dodgers on the tv at the bar. Overall, great food and great experience, but very pricey.

The food is amazing! I had the double bacon burger. One of the best burgers I've ever had. My bf had the brisket which he absolutely loved as well. The atmosphere is really enjoyable too. Our server Virginia was great. She was very professional, attentive and knowledgeable. They are also very accommodating to those with gluten sensitivities. Can't wait to go back!

Yummm. I had the nachos and they were quite good. My biggest issue with them is the meat wasn't that great on them and it is in large chunks which just doesn't move with the nachos. Ps these things are huge I ate it for dinner and had over half the pan (that's right they come out in a huge pan) left.

Monday nights they roast a whole pig. My husband had the 4 oz which comes with veggies. Luckily he wasn't too hungry so it was great. He said the taste was really good.

The others in our party had a burger and brisket. Both got thumbs up.

Cool casual atmosphere and plenty tvs if you're trying to watch a game.

Great, casual and lively ambiance! Stayed at MGM and decided to try this place out. The mac and cheese was so simple but very satisfying. It had the perfect creaminess and consistency that I prefer in my mac and cheese. It was also a pretty big side order. 

The star was the champ burger! It was definitely a champ with its flavorful patty, soft and fresh buns, bacon, smoked gouda and American cheese, and their "secret sauce"! It came with a side of BBQ fries. The shoestring fries were dusted with BBQ seasoning reminiscent of Lays' BBQ chips. It was very addicting. 

Overall, a great experience and definitely had me thinking about their champ burger the next day!

LOVED this place!  We were craving a burger, and the 1842 Burger did not disappoint - we added Gouda and it was so incredible, and the meat was perfectly done wagyu beef.  The Mac and cheese side dish was decadent.  Great sports pub ambience.

Came here for lunch and was not overly impressed.  My boyfriend and I each had a beer, shared a couple appetizers and one entree and spent about $90.  The food was a great twist on pub food and our waitress was awesome but the price was just too much for what were we ordered. Had it not been so overpriced I would have given it 4 or even 5 stars. The BBQ platter was really good and definitely enough good to share.  The fried pickles and the sauce they came came were delicious as well. If you are looking to grab a quick and inexpensive place to eat then this is not the place for you.  If you are okay spending almost $100 on lunch then go for it!

Came for drinks and pre gaming....very small happy hour menu but that can be expected given the hotel it's attached too....decent beer selection tho and the bartenders are great about letting you sample the different selections. I didn't get any food but the aroma surrounding the room was almost enough to make me open up my appetite but I found the inner hulk strength to resist. My most surprising moment would have to be the number of tvs in the place.....would not be a bad place to kick back before another event
We had two excellent pre-show dinners. I had the flat iron steak and wifey had the brisket. Both were perfectly prepared. But their fries--the best we've ever had!

Amazing staff. The chef was not only talented, but very accommodating when I substituted my side dish for the salmon entree. The salmon was cooked perfectly. I don't even really like salmon and only order it occasionally, but I am so glad I did. I almost ordered a second salmon just to take home. And here's the kicker: apparently the chef thought the first time it was cooked it was overdone. So he sent out an appetizer (the lettuce wraps with crab - delish!) and his apologies. The manager was gracious and attentive, checking back to make sure when the dish did arrive it was to my liking. I even ordered one of their milkshake-cake desserts. The milkshake was adorable and perfectly sized for the small delicious coconut cake that it accompanied. The cake was a little dry, but not so much that it was ruined. I did mention it to the manager, and she was again very gracious and said she would let the chef know. And the bar? Beautiful. And I mean the staff as well as the ambiance. The essence oils around the bar added a nice effect, and the bar staff was knowledgeable and very friendly. Amanda was a great bartender and seemed to be interacting with her guests well. She made a delicious skinny margarita for me and was a great person to chat with while I sat and enjoyed my meal. They also have those new self-serve beer tap tables where you get an access key from the server and can pour your own drafts at the table. These will be great for football time and I can't wait to reserve my own seat! In a town where celebrity chefs are around every corner, PUB 1842 stands out with it's great bartenders, unpretentious managers, and chefs that truly care about the guest as much as the meal. Can't wait to go back.
My wife's food was cold. The baked beans were tasteless.   The service was nice and the waiter was friendly and did make sure my wife's meal was redone and hot.

Happy hour is the best hour.

One of the few things Chicago lacks is happy hour. So whenever I travel, I make it a point to hit up all the happy hours I can. Must do:

-Lobster grilled cheese
-Moonshine cocktail
-Sliders
-The Cuban cocktail

The Moonshine was especially hella strong and worth every discounted penny. Service was prompt and they even advised us a couple minutes before happy hour ended so we could order more drinks, even before we finished ours. I was only a little disappointed that it was so casual and I looked like a weirdo wearing a skirt in a sea of jerseys and flip flops. It is Vegas and most tourists don't know how to look cute like me so I understand.

Thanks for looking out, MM!

After my boyfriend and I walked from The Best Western Plus Casino Royal we were famished. It took us two hours to find the damn place, but when we did, let me tell you, it was soooooo worth it. Good service, good food, good drinks, just great! If you don't eat here you're stupid! 
TRY THE FRICKLES!

Nice place -- we sat down in about ten minutes, had a great server (Lindsey), and had great food. I had the Pub Fixe: a 1/2-pound burger with salad, Bud Light and a cookie, all for $21. A championship football game was occurring, and in true bar fashion, all 5,000 flat-screens were tuned in and everyone was into it. Despite the busyness and the crowds, I was very pleased with the service and meal. Will definitely be back!

I'm really not into kissing Michael Mina's bootay as we have an RN74 in Seattle and though I've only been there once...I wasn't that impressed with the food. The service, however, was exceptional. 

So let's talk about Pub 1842. I went there this past week and just as with RN74, the service was outstanding. I'm truly surprised to read reviews blasting the waitstaff, as my experience was quite the opposite. We were attended to in a very timely fashion by folks who really seemed to care about the customers' experience. 

As for the food - outstanding. It will probably sound silly to rave about a salad in Las Vegas, but the Avocado Kale Caesar is nothing short of amazing. More chefs need to incorporate artichoke chips into their dishes. I ordered the Peanut Butter Crunch burger and it was just as fun as you might imagine based on the menu description. the peanut butter isn't oozing all over the place, but when you get that money bite...well, it's money. 

What else can I say?! OH - excellent fries and cocktails! I think I've covered everything.
Fried pickles and burgers to die for (and that's okay). Energetic service in a comfortable oasis away from the MGM madness found at nearby places.

Years ago, Seablue at MGM was one of our favorite restaurants. It had great seafood Mediterranean influence and everything was light and healthy. It has since switched gears, the space closed for a brief time and re-opened, last summer, as yet another Gastropub. Burger and pizza joints have monopolized the dining scene on the strip much to my chagrin. Michael Mina joined the trend with Pub 1842. 

The space has a great pub feel. Servers were quick and friendly. The draft beer selection was a bit lacking, but they did offer Weihenstephaner ($12) which is a solid choice. Beers were on special during our visit, buy one, get one. 

I have a weakness for all things duck. So, the spring rolls ($16) were an easy choice when it came to choosing an appetizer. They offered a Bourbon Burger ($19) on special. Which Frank was unable to resist, he's been hooked on Maker's Mark since our tour in KY earlier this year. I chose the 1842 Burger. 

The spring rolls failed to impress, they fell into the category of your typical pub grub offering. The 1842 is served in a basket (awkward for eating) and comes with caramelized onions, sautéed mushrooms and a truffle aioli. I was offered cheese, but Swiss was not an option and it was what sounded most appealing. I had requested the burger to be cooked medium, but it was a poor choice. It was well done. It was dry. The bun was dry. And I found the truffle aioli to be far more tangy than expected and the truffle flavor was very faint. I struggled to eat half of it before throwing in the towel. The Bourbon Burger was a better choice, but still left Frank pretty underwhelmed. Both burgers came with a generous portion of seasoned fries. 

The prices are inflated and the menu items do not warrant the price. I've always been a big fan of Michael Mina restaurants, but this one missed the mark. It's really quite sad that Seablue shuttered for this.
Yum!!!! This place is sooooo good. Fried pickels ..amazing! The 1842 burger was great!!! Even the fries were yummy. Service was kinda dry,  but everything else was perfection!

This is Michael Mina's newest restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been to many other Michael restaurants so I thought I knew what to expect but this was different. 

Michael Mina has officially nailed casual! This place is a lot more low key than his other restaurants but is equally as tasty and refined. Our table ordered a BUNCH of appetizers and shared them. 

We got:
-Shelfish platter
-crabcakes
-crab deviled eggs
-nachos
-ahi tuna poke 

All of it was amazing! I particularly loved the ahi poke. It is similar to his famous tuna tartare but is more casual (if that makes sense?). 

I would definitely give this place a try.

Stopped by to have a few beers on my way back from the pool. I chose to sit at the bar and the bartenders were very welcoming. They provided great service! Enjoyed 2 rounds and watched part of a game on the TV before leaving. Overall it's a cool place with great drinks!

Michael Mina's take on upscale bar food at the MGM. Their HH pricing allows you to get a good sample of the menu's food and drinks for a discounted price, available 4-7PM daily including holidays!
Also, you're able to order from the HH menu TO-GO, which is unheard of elsewhere- and appreciated. 

LOBSTER GRILLED CHEESE $9; smallish sandwich served with a veritable mountain of seasoned fries. Combining cheese and seafood is always a little dicey in my book but this dish does it well. Sadly, the fries, though plentiful and visibly seasoned, lacked flavor and crisp. They also do not reheat well, consider yourself warned.

KOREAN PORK RIBS: $11, four ribs with gochujang glaze served with peanuts and mint. Or they're supposed to. Mine came sad and lonely on a plate with zero presentation. Admittedly I ordered them right before HH ended but presentation should still be consistent and the additional components likely would have made the dish much better. As it was, I wouldn't rush to order them again but did find them to be a bit meatier than expected. Flavor was one-note, sauce seemed to be sriracha-based, wouldn't order again.

CINNAMON HARLOT: $7 George Dickel rye whiskey simple syrup, cinnamon. A simple sipping drink, very strong, ordered on the rocks and got a cool boulder of ice in my glass. Not wanting to be plastered after one drink, I asked for it to be diluted with Sprite, which is apparently fairly common. Decent flavor but not something I'd get again.

SANGRIA: $8 red red wine, velvet falernum spiced rum, blackberry liqueur, lemon. It's rare for me to find a sangria I don't like, so I really enjoyed this drink much more than the Harlot. Fruity and strong with bold flavors, decent drink size too.

Service bumped up the score higher than the product alone- bartender was attentive and friendly, accommodated my HH order for takeout and fixed my drink to my liking. I'd come back for other apps or a burger in the future.

Oh, no...Chef Mina, why did you remove your delicious Lobster Corn Dogs from your menu? We returned for lunch with high hopes of once again dining on some Lobster Corn Dogs, great Black Angus burgers and knocking back a couple of cold brews.  Instead, we found that the Lobster Rolls have been replaced by Lobster Fritters.

Our "crack" service team, Juan and Miguel, assured us that the fritters were a nice change to the menu, popular, and tasted really good. But, we weren't the only ones who asked for the corn dogs. Our slight disappointment quickly changed as we sloshed down our Kronenbourg beers and dug into our perfectly cooked, hand patted, hand crafted 1/2 pound burgers. I ordered the 1842 Burger which was a 1/2 pound of juicy beefiness topped with caramelized onions, mushrooms and truffle aioli. My husband chose The Champ that was a behemoth with smoked Gouda, American cheese (NOT your typical Kraft slice), crisp thick strips of Applewood-smoked bacon, lettuce and special sauce. Both burgers were served between toasted brioche buns in a seemingly bottomless basket of BBQ French fries.  

We enjoyed our return dine as it confirmed the versatility or range of Chef Mina's talent.  He is able to take a simple comfort food like hamburger and transform it into a gastropub delight. Pub 1842 is a comfortable dining atmosphere complete with a full bar, a wide selection of global beers on tap and in bottles and multiple flat-screen televisions tuned into various sports events.

I give this review three stars because the service was extraordinary. Jean s was our server. She is a jewel. So friendly attentive professional and perfect. She made us feel like her most important table. And the host (a Hispanic young guy) was fabulous. Really friendly and personable. The food was fresh and put together with love and care but not very impressive and I did not like it. The calamari was good on the inside but the reading tasted too pulverized and while it was crisp it soaked up too much oil. The marinara was not tasty. That smiley flavor is no good. The bacon Gouda burger was sweet and didn't taste savory like a burger should. It had the same flavor or something as the smoked marinara and the same as the fries. Everything kind of had the same "tone". Even the bacon on the burger tasted the same as the beef, the seasoning on the sauce and the same as the fries. There was no contrast in the flavors of the food. My tongue was bored.  Neither me or my husband even ate half of our burger. I will say that the salad was amazing. The salad dressings were fantastic. Tasted homemade and delicious. I will be thinking about the ranch and the vinaigrette for a while. Those really were the best part of lunch.

Food is good but the atmosphere is a total pub. 
We would come back here but great for lunch or after pool. Not good if you want to dine out.

I was staying at MGM and stumbled across this place. Ordered the bacon burger with bacon jam. WOW! That jam was delicious. Thought there was a little too much cheese on it and I just scraped some off. The fries had a nice spice to them. Didn't even want ketchup near them. The burger was pretty big. I ordered it without bread and it was still a lot for me to finish.

The bbq plate was a good value. I sampled some of it off my husband. They had a great beer selection. OH, i was very surprised by the house-made Fireball. Did a couple shots of that. It was smooth and delicious. Really enjoy it! Intended to eat there again before I left but ran out of time. I will return!

I love this place. We've been in Vegas quite a number of times this summer including our wedding, and by FAR, this has been the best gastropub we've set our feet in. 

1. Our favorite Bartender: LIZ
 I love this gal. She was the first person to serve us at the bar when we first visited, and she is AWESOME. She knows everything and anything there is to know about the beers they serve, will make you FANTASTIC cocktails (even come up with something new on the fly based on your mood), offer you just what you're craving, and is sneaky quick about making sure your eating/drink area is clean and pleasant. We easily spend over $100 between the two of us when she's working and keeps us coming back for more. It's nice to have a fav spot to grub and drink where you know the staff makes you feel welcomed.

2. The Food.
Okay, first off, this is frickin' VEGAS. DUH, everything on the strip is going to be hella expensive. But you know what? For the price point, this place serves, HANDS DOWN, the best food. I put this place down as "good for 'Late Night' and 'Desserts'" because gastropub food only goes so far and if you're expecting "sit-down dinner," this place probably wouldn't cut it. But, if you're out with friends and wanna get some grub before you hit the tables/slots and have a couple beers, this is the place to do it. If you have a party of 4 or more, I recommend sharing the HUGE nacho platter (comes on a frickin' baking sheet) or if you have a small party, get the fried pickles ("frickles!") and an entree to share. The baked ziti is our favorite; between hubby and I, we've ordered it twice within the span of 72hours and it's been awesome every time.

3. The Ambiance
It's so relaxing and nice to just be able to come in, sit down, have a beer, get some grub, and zone out watching some sports news. And this pub just gets it right on the money. I have been to many a gastropubs on the strip and I don't quite know what it is that other places don't have. I assume it has something to do with the fact that they have the bar in the center and it really focuses on its forte--being the best beer pub on the street. They also have a dart board and beer pong table in the corner if you're so inclined; for no additional charge (I assume; we weren't charged to play). I also love that EVERYTHING in print (menus, posters, coasters, etc.) at this place is so frickin' beautifully designed. I've gone to many a places where I'm sure they've got some great food, but their menu was soooooo poorly designed it just ruined the whole eating experience for me. 

4. The Service.
What can I say, this really just reiterates number 1, but I want to make sure the whole restaurant also gets recognition. The food comes piping hot right out of the open kitchen and you can really see the kitchen working it, every moment that it's open. You can really tell the people behind the bar and the kitchen really works as a team. 

...Gosh, writing this makes me hungry. Maybe we should get some lunch there. Haven't tried them for lunch yet. Yeah, frickles sound good right about now. Bye guys!

Love, love, love Michael Mina.  Pub 1842 didn't disappoint.  We started with the happy hour punch and the 1842 nachos, hot soft pretzels and lobster fritters.  The nachos are huge and delicious.  The whole table loved them.  The pretzels and fritters were good but didn't compare to the nachos.  We couldn't finish them between the 4 of us.  For our mains I got shrimp and grits.  The rest of table had shrimp and scallop ceviche and 2 orders of pub steak frites.  We also had a side of mac and cheese and the shake tasting.  We were all pretty full from the apps but managed to do some damage.  Everyone enjoyed their selection.  The shake tasting was the weak point of the meal.  The shakes were melty and not strongly flavored.  We had a hard time figuring out what each flavor was.  The color of the shake ended up being the deciding factor.  Service was ok.  She wasn't around much but did warn us when happy hour was about to end and got us another round.  That is a big plus in my book.

Barbecue

Means different things to different folks.  Ordered a brisket sandwich with fries and kale slaw - $32.   Plenty of brisket.  Crusty edges, no.  Smoke ring, no.  Smoky smell, no.  Juicy and fatty, yes.  Not sure how it was originally cooked, but it wasn't smoked.  They removed it from a steamer, sliced and diced and gave it to me - 20 minutes after ordering it to go.  
The sandwich and fries were good, the slaw had a cup too much salt in it.  Not worth $32, even at Vegas, baby prices and barbecue it was not.

I tried the fried pickles for the first time and they were delicious and the sauce served with it was creamy and really complimented the acidity of the pickles. I like my burgers well done and thats exactly how they cooked it, it tasted really good. Everyone was really friendly and our server Sarah was great.

During my last trip to Las Vegas I tried out Pub 1842 after a day at the MGM pool.  The whole experience was great!  For food we got some appetizers, the lobster corn dogs, duck spring rolls, and my favorite the 1842 nachos.  The serving sizes were more than enough to feed the 4 of us and the prices are very reasonable for a Las Vegas restaurant.

We tried out a couple of cocktails too while we were at the Pub.  The Moscow Mule was done perfectly.  They also make their own version of "Fireball Whiskey" in house.  It had more of the whiskey taste than the sugary Fireball that you buy in the stores. 

I don't want to leave out the wonderful service that we received.  Our waitress Lindsey was very attentive and a pleasure to have as a server. She made some great recommendations and brought our food and beverages out quickly.

Our party loved the experience so much that we returned the following day after our 2nd day at the pool.

Conveniently located in the MGM. We decided to eat here because it was close to our room.   It wasn't too packed when we arrived but it still took us 20 mins to get seated.  No biggie.  They didn't have a table for us so we ended up sitting at the bar.  Took the bartender 10 minutes before we had any water.  The food took over 30 mins for some pre cooked smoked meat.  seriously?

Verdict:
Kale slaw: not that great 

Pulled pork: this is probably the driest pulled pork that I've ever encountered. 0 stars

Brisket: this was decent. Solid 3.5 stars  

Ribs: not fall of the bone at all.  Very chewy. 1 star. 
For $32.... This is comical. 

Probably won't be going back to this place.

Had the pork green chilli style breakfast burrito from the hangover cure menu. U don't need a hangover as an excuse to eat this beauty! I shared it with my fiancé and I wish I didn't. $18 ex tip and tax. Cooked perfectly. The chef said the the pork is cooked slowly for a day. So tender and delicious. Best I have ever had. I don't know why it is closed on Mondays, cos I wanted to go back! I loved how you can watch meat cook over the wild flames and the chef watches the food as it goes out- Ramsay style.

Came for the burgers. For a pub in Las Vegas, they need to step up their game. A $17 burger should not come served on paper in a basket! That right there wraps up the flavor as well. Too bad... The fries actually were not good!

When I was last in Vegas, we stopped in here for a bite to eat. It looked interesting. We were staying in the MGM and it was close. 

As everything in Vegas, it's a little expensive. It's also very good. 

The service was slow, even though it was around noon and there was only about two other groups. That is my only complaint. 

I had the California greens salad. For only having a few ingredients, it was amazing! The flavors were great, while being light and simplistic. 

My fiance had fish and chips. They were well cooked. I stole a few fries that were very tasty- not too greasy or salty. 

Another in our group had their burger and said it was also amazing. It looked delicious!


I had a delightful glass of port wine as well. 

I would recommend and will likely go back next time I am in Vegas!
Seemed overpriced, not a big menu, sent one plate back for being undercooked.....but....service was excellent, food was great, and the brisket was unbelievable.  Closed on Wednesdays.

For a Michael Mina restaurant, meh. I was not wowed by the food at all, my friends did not like it as much. we had burgers, fried pickles, and the one thing I liked the most were the lobster corn dogs. The beer selection was pretty decent, that definitely is the highlight of this place.

Great food. Fries are outstanding.Pulled pork sandwich was outstanding. Great nachos. Lots of tv's. Has clean look, decor could be better. Trying very hard to be a sports bar. Too pristine with store bought decorations. Like it but not as best place to catch a game

Usually to earn a 5 you can't have any weak dishes.  However it's possible. 

We heard about the lobster corn dogs and we had to order them.  My wife (who doesn't eat meat) loved them because they tasted like a corn dog.  I didn't care for them because they tasted like a corn dog.  The flavors were very true to life and the sauce was excellent, but at over $5 each I felt the lobster got a little overworked.  Maybe a lesser ingredient would have made an equally awesome flavor.  But alas.  

My wife got a kale and avocado salad which she loved, but I'm not a huge fan of bitter greens.  I guess everyone has their thing. 

I got the "Champ" burger.  Best burger patty I've ever had.  So juicy and flavorful.  The sauce was really good, but a little messy and who doesn't love a ton of bacon.  This thing is a mess though, don't try to be impressing any ladies when you order it.  

The service was very personable and friendly too.  

I would definitely come back to try some different things.

food was pretty good. the hostesses were not. this was 11/1/2014 the 2nd night of phish for dinner. there were quite a few people waiting and i walked up the hostess bar in front. i stood there for what seemed like an eternity. they do not even acknowledge my existence. No - we'll be with you shorlty - no nothing. i thought about leaving because of how rude the 2 girls were being. i'm standing there looking at them with my girlfriend. there's no way they did not see me. i'm feeling very uncomfortable and unwelcome. they finally talk to me and tell me 10min wait. that's not bad so i say ok. i mean, for 10 min wait, they make me wait at least 2-3 min just standing there to tell me that. i'm pretty pissed and don't understand. it does not take much to say - hi, be with you in a second. 

the girl who waited on us at our table was great however. we ordered the burger and split it. $1.50 to split it which is annoying but minor compared to NYC prices to split something. we split it because we thought it would be huge. it's a $20 burger but it was not really that big. we could have got an entire burger each but the fries had some sort of BBQ flavoring on them which neither of us liked. overall the food was pretty good. the service was good. the hostesses get -1 star. i wish i could get their names and get them fired. i've never felt more unwelcome at a restaurant in my life.i only ate there because it was next to the venue for phish and it was late and i did not want food court food. but i ended up getting food court food the next night for dinner and got much better, welcoming service, which is ridiculous. MM please fire you hostesses or at least get some girls or guys that can at least be nice.
This place is terrible. Food is mediocre and staffs slow on not nearly as attentive a restaurant of this caliber should be. Many employees working, but most of them just "hanging out".
Wide selection of draft and bottled beers at the bar. BBQ ribs were outstanding and service attentive and prompt.

Four words... Peanut-Butter Crunch Burger. And in case you needed another reason to try it besides me telling you it is amazing... it has Bacon Jam! My wife and I loved the BBQ Fries as well. In fact, we wished we would have just ordered more fries and split the Burger because the serving portions are huge!

Of course we also ordered macaroni & cheese AND soft pretzels because it is a Pub and you always over-indulge, but I will say that when we go back (and we will) all I need is the love of a Peanut-Butter Crunch burger and mounds of BBQ fries!

Ordered the burger called the champ. It tastes like a real BBQ grilled burger! Would definitely come back again for it.. Also ordered the appetizer nachos and feeds about 3 to 4 people seems like it would be great on a drunken night as a snack not meal ..

Save your dinero, because this place is no bueno. 

Most of the restaurants at MGM close for lunch, so we were left with a few options, and Pub 1842 was one of them. I thought it would be just fine since I'm accustomed to bar food, and actually love it. Michael Mina, why did you fail me? You left a lot to be desired.

First off, there was nobody at the front to seat us (and it's a sit down style restaurant, so you can't just go in and seat yourself.) After a few minutes, someone finally came to help us out. It wasn't busy at all, maybe half a dozen tables at best. 

We thumbed through the menu and were aghast at the exorbitant prices for bar food. $30 for fish and chips?! Whatever, I was starving so I ordered it anyway. I paired off my entree with a $4 coca cola. The other person at my table had a $15 salad (just seasoned asparagus), which she had the option of adding chicken for $12 more. Needless to say she did not enjoy her meal and was left starving afterward.

Here is the rundown of my dish: Two heavily breaded beer battered flakey fillets on a bed of thick cut fries. I did not enjoy the breading at all. It tasted like Larry the Cable Guy's Beer Batter you can buy at the $.99 Cent Store. The fish was fine, and was flakey with no discoloration. I did not like ANY of the dipping sauces I ordered. They were all watery and gross. The tartar sauce tasted like coleslaw, the BBQ sauce was basically spicy water, and the ranch was watery as well. The fish and chips back home at the Fish Enterprise tastes WAY better and it comes with clam chowder and is HALF the price.

The one positive thing about Michael Mina's Pub 1842 is the service. Once seated, the staff was very friendly. Besides that one positive, I don't think I will ever be back to this place again.

My suggestion to anybody thinking of dining here is to save your $$$ and eat at the food court across from it!

Excellent! I was unsure of a mixed drink that I wanted and the bartender blew all of my expectations away with the drink I got. Also tried the 1842 burger, the best experience from a burger I have ever had. I am definitely going back before we leave.

The champ burger was delicious.  Although the description says bacon and bacon, you only get two slices.  The fries are good.  

My sister had the shrimp cocktail which she enjoyed.  

Service was great!

This was a random stop I had no plans on. After a lovely cigar and enough alcohol to kill a small horse, my body needed something a bit more healthy in it (but not too much healthier) A rather large bar, and a pleasant atmosphere greeting me as I walked in. My usual choice of sitting at the bar, I was quickly greeted by a man that moved like the Flash. He was serving us so quickly (There were at least 15 people at my side of the bar, and a handful of others at the other end) I had to actively make sure I didn't start addressing him as Barry Allen. 
It took about 10 minutes for the arrival of the mac & cheese I ordered. It was a bit small for the cost ($11), but it was very tasty. 
Definitely worth the stop for both the food & service.

I was very excited to taste Michael Mina's new concept. I went with a group of 4, we were sat in a booth close to the hallway. I am aware that they are doing 1,000 covers a day, so I do know that they are in the weeds all day long and the restaurant is turn and burn. We ordered cocktails, and I took the server's advice and ordered the very first one on the cocktail menu. Bad choice, probably one of the worst cocktails I've had, and I love ginger beer so I was very excited, but ended up with lime water. 

 We all ordered different appetizers to share, fried pickles, pretzels, nachos, lobster corn dog, duck spring rolls, and green chili. The pickle batter, was disappointingly soggy, and the sauce that is served with it was like straight up mayo, but on the upside the lobster corn dog was very good, it didn't sound too great to me but it tasted awesome, crispy batter, tasty center, good sauce too!! The nachos were good, served on a quarter sheet pan which I thought was pretty cool. The duck spring rolls were a little too greasy, and not such a huge fan of the Mae Ploy kind of sauce. The green chili was good , the only thing with all of the appetizers was the temperature, I'm sure they can't hold too many things under the heat lamps due to space and volume, but it all would have been better if it was a bit hotter.

 Next, the entrees that we ordered were the chicken, the burger, and a lobster roll, with broccolini and magical mushrooms. the chicken was overcooked, the burger was not too great, the lobster roll was pretty good, nice brioche bun crispy and very filling. The fries that accompanied the roll were exceptionally good, I was full but I could not stop eating them, The broccolini was charred, and the magical mushrooms were inedible, they tasted like someone put a piece of charcoal in your mouth. I'm sure that's not what they were aiming for. 

The desserts were both great, we had a lemon cake which we cleaned the plate, and the roasted peach & almond buckle, at this point I could hardly breathe, but still had to try dessert, and I was very glad I did, it was all great. 

On another note, our server was great, she was super nice and knowledgeable about the menu, she stopped by constantly to see that we were doing ok. The reason I would not return was the noise level, I realize that there are a lot of people sitting down, but I felt like I was in a sports stadium I had to plug my ears all through the night, because the table behind us was screaming at the TV. Very annoying to have to put up with when all you wanted to do was enjoy dinner with friends. I'm sure they can't do much to fix that though.

Let me first start off by saying that we are huge Michael Mina fans. We were absolutely in love with Sea Blue (every year we looked forward to a Las Vegas trip simply because of Sea Blue - The Chilean Sea Bass dish... when your lady friend is obsessed with a certain dish, you know it's THAT good!).

Michael Mina also owned Knobhill Tavern... had one of the best meals of my life there 2 years ago. I remember we even ordered seconds on a full belly. YUM!

Unfortunately Sea Blue has now been replaced with Pub 1842. We were extremely excited to try this pub, and even made reservations months before. But, that's pretty much where the excitement wore off; This place was one of the worst dining experiences we've all had, not just in Vegas.

First off, the table taps looked pretty sweet, but right out of the gate they were out of Weihenstephaner.

For starters we went with some Homemade Frickles, Hot Salted Pretzels with 'Merican beer cheese, poached egg, and an order of Duck Spring Rolls.

Our Frickles were extremely bland and no one wanted to finish them. At least they were hot, as our order of Pretzels and Spring Rolls were cold. After we sent them back, we didn't get a poached egg in the cheese when they returned with a new one. Since they were kind of hot, well, lukewarm I'd say, we just shrugged it off. The Spring Rolls were bland as well, but that was only the beginning.

For our main entrees, not one person out of the group of six enjoyed theirs.

The Wedge Salad featured huge, undercooked, fatty bacon that ended up lining the edges of the bowl. Even a waitress was hard pressed not to notice.

The Mac & Cheese was bland and had too much black truffle. When I was younger I use to think, 'How can you screw up a Mac & Cheese?' but in my years I've grown to know that it's the simple dishes that are hard to execute and easy to muck up. Even in a group of 6, we barely ate half of it, and left the rest.

After seeing the bacon that accompanied the Wedge salad, we were quite scared at what The Smoked Bacon Burgers would look like. Both of them came out extremely rare after they were ordered as medium rare. Another send back. Fries? Just ok. Lukewarm at best.

The Heritage Turkey Burger had so much lettuce on it while The Smoked Bacon Burgers had so little, we all joked that the Turkey Burger ran off with their lettuce. Half of the Turkey Burger was left. Doggie Bag? Ya, right.

As it stands, we left the best for last: Magical Mushrooms. The faces each of us made after trying a bite of these was priceless. The Mushrooms had a really foul after taste and almost tasted of burnt meat. Obviously they were extremely overcooked, and it was hard to pinpoint the angle Pub 1842 was going for these. I would have been much happier with some awesome salted, buttery, and fresh herb mushrooms rather than whatever these 'Magical' Mushrooms were put out to be. They were so bad that we had to tell the waitress of how foul they tasted. No joke, all six of us spit them up into our napkins. A sight to behold.

Even our pickles were past their expirations and just plain uneatable.

Our waitress was super nice, but her attitude completely changed after we sent back some of the items. Since we were in a group of six and had to catch the hockey game after (FROZEN FURY!), we really tried our hardest to stomach most of the dishes since we wouldn't have time to eat anything else before the drop of the puck.

Once the time came for the check, the waitress dropped it on the table and literally ran the other direction without making eye contact or saying a word. It was quite clear that she wanted to move on past this experience with a blind eye. I have to admit, so did we.

What started out really bad, ended even worse. We all hated the food so much that you couldn't convince any of us to come back, even for a free meal.

My review is only for the drink.  While here at convention for RE/MAX, we met friends here who were eating.  We had already eaten so I got a drink.  Overall, it was good and the service was, too.

I did try a frickle (fried pickle) and it was tasty but I don't typically eat fried food.

I thought it was cute they had a special drink for RE/MAX call the "Real-Tea".

Great sports bar to nurse a hangover. 
It has multiple TVs

The BLT was a disappointment but the drink "The Meaty" was awesome. It was a meaty bloody mary. The fresh pork rinds were also perfect.

Yes i ate a lot of bacon on the day i went to this establishment.  OINKOINK

A good place to enjoy a couple of drinks as well as to have dinner (or both, as I did recently).  Relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff.   

They have a good tap beer selection-a couple of dozen that I could see-and having a Deschutes brew is a must try.  

Food-wise, the wedge salad is good-the balsamic drizzle along with a lightly creamy but chunky bleu cheese dressing was perfect.   Shrimp & grits was good-blackened shrimp-and the grits were just right texture-wise.   A slice of Andouille made it every better.  My wife had the filet, which came with a tangy chimichuri sauce and a sweet and spicy bbq sauce on the side.   The street corn was a good side to share.

Everything was good and the nacho plate looked awfully good...next time for sure!

A must eat here place at the MGM!
Hostess was accommodating and friendly and sat us where we wanted to be seated. Carlos L was our waiter. He was so good he should be training others. The place had and atmosphere that was warm, inviting, and fun. Good place to watch a game. We ordered the tomato soup with grilled cheese sandwiches, pulled pork sandwich w/cabbage, split and two Dragons Milk Beers. Tomato soup was outstanding but the grilled cheese sandwich was average. The pulled pork sandwich was the star of the show. The meat was super tender, wonderful flavor, and with the cabbage brought all together for savory goodness. The seasoned fries that came with, were crispy and tasty. Had a great time, great food, and we will most definitely eat there again. Thank you, Carlos for making our visit great!

Went there for drinks after our CSI exhibit, this was a seafood restaurant before, I am glad it's now a Michael Mina casual restaurant and bar. 

The atmosphere was very casual and relaxing, we sat at the bar, got carded, I asked for a Bloody Mary with extra spicy flavor, bartender made me a very nice one, he blended some onions and pickles to put on top of my drink, it was refreshing and different, he gave me a mini tobacco to add in some extra flavor, wow, one of the best Bloody Mary I have ever had! It was only $10 to my surprise, had a few of those, didn't even bother to try other drinks! Hubby had double shot espresso, he was not in mood for alcohol that afternoon. ;p 

I see they have good beer selections, samplers, didn't check out food menu, cause we had a big lunch earlier, I was too full to eat more, but I really liked our bar experience, bartenders were very friendly. We had relaxing down times there. Would love to try the food next time!

Even though there were open tables it took 10 min to get seated. Asked for burger well done and it was under cooked but all in all it had decent service and good tasting food. I wouldn't say it's better than burgr and would rather go there.

Not a bad gastro pub, took 45 minutes to be seated on a Monday. Great selection of Craft brews, the food was decent for the price. Quick tip, the nachos are HUGE served on a large baking sheet, could feed six! The wait staff needs to improve on their personalities and attitude, ours was a cold b*tch.

I have 4 words for you...

Peanut Butter Crunch Burger

That is all. Really. Just GO! GO NOW!!! Get that burger and shove it in your face!!!

You WILL thank me.

You're welcome.

Food was ok, but waiter tricked us.  If you use yelp to check in it states free blue moon beer.  The waiter said it was buy one get one free........after we got our check.  But it doesnt state that.  Horrible service.

Just got back from Vegas and having time to catch up on what I can admit I did there. Stopped by this spot because I saw all the crowd a commotion and me being me I had to see. Glad I did!! Even though it was super busy and apparently brand new they really seemed to have their stuff together. Our server Marissa was on point the whole time and didn't skip a beat with our needs. Food took a bit to get out but hey, I said they were packed. When it got out it was amazing. I had the pb crunch burger and my buddy the turkey burger. He said prob one of the better ones he has had. I mean its Michael Mina so you kinda expect a little high end feel to it and was definitely delivered. 

Over great and ill be back next trip to Vegas. Hopefully Marissa hasn't moved on by then, very rare to get small city attention and service out there.
Super juicy, fresh dry aged beef, and allllll the fixings. Great beer and whiskey selection. He's def. got the "theme" restaurants down...

What a disappointment this place was. The drinks were very weak, service was slow and the waiter spent more time flirting than serving food.
Tried the brisket expecting am amazing piece of meat, average at best. On par with Famous Daves at double the price.
everyone who got the burger raved about it, so stick with the burger

We really enjoyed this place.  The food and staff were amazing. The food was innovative, fresh and new.  

We had four people ordering something different from the menu and each dish looked, smelled and tasted great !!!

We highly recommend this restaurant to everyone.
Maybe I had a bad night but my beer was lukewarm, they didn't charge me and the lobster fritters were ok but not worth $17.  What a shame for what looks like a great place.

Damn, MGM needed, and finally got a gastropub in Pub 1842.  About a billion beers on tap, and I'm not exaggerating.  Incredible food for pub fare, and really good service in the zoo portion of MGM Grand, near the 15,000 seat arena.  The staff does really well, given that it's chaos there every night a concert is in town, I was impressed.

"Was it a dream where you were standing in sort of sun-god robes on top of a pyramid, and there were hundreds of naked women screaming and throwing little pickles at you?" -- Real Genius (1985)

I'm a big fan of Michael Mina - having eaten at his establishments in San Francisco and even when this location was called Knob Hill years ago - so when I found out there was another Michael Mina place to check out - I was all in.  I grabbed my girlfriends and quickly made a reservation for us and off we went.

I forgot how maze-like MGM Grand can be and they have made so many changes since I was here last time.  Plus, with the Nascar folks in town - it was a zoo. So we were a couple of minutes late for our reservation - but despite our tardiness and how packed they were - they seated us right away in a 6-top booth.

We were starving and immediately opted for cocktails and snacks - ordering the frickles (fried pickle spears) and the pretzels with a gooey beer-cheese dip with a fried (maybe poached) egg in the center.  The pretzels were amazing and I will say that the dip was better once someone broke the egg into and swirled it all around - I didn't even realize it was in there until someone else had the guts to break it and mix it all up.  The frickles were also delicious - with a snap to them and a sauce that was to die for - I could have put that stuff on everything!

My cocktail was the Soda Popinski.  Not being a fan of sweet cocktails - I tend to go for the tart ones or bourbon laced ones.  This was Grey Goose, Fresh Lime, and Ginger Beer - so perfectly tart and packed a real punch! Loved it!

For my entree - I was torn.  I finally gave in and ordered the Double Dog Dare.  This was two bacon-wrapped wagyu hot dogs, topped with guacamole, pico de gallo, and chicharones. So double the pork on top of fancy beef dogs - you cannot go wrong. But damn - this was a LOT of food.  I didn't want the fries it came with, so I asked for a substitute of the Mac and cheese.  I was warned it would cost extra - yeah, I'm in Vegas - I don't care.  So I opted for the smoked gouda mac and cheese with broccoli.  Not too shabby, but I've had better.

This is not a hot dog you can eat with your hands - you have to use a knife and fork.  Not that I minded - because it was DAMN good.
